title: Excellent Opportunity - Data Analyst in Chicago, IL (Onsite) - Fulltime.
description: <strong>Job Title: Data Analyst<br><br>Location: Chicago, IL<br><br>Type: Fulltime<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Need 7yrs as data analyst and total 12-15 years in IT<br><br></strong>Candidates who are working or have Data analyst / working with business in getting data requirements and working with the solution/data architects/engineers for the data they collected and analysis it. During the data collection they might be writing some SQL queries to get the data need etc. They need interaction with business data &amp; application teams<br><br><strong>Must-Have Skills &amp; Experience:-<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's or master's degree in business, finance, statistics, computer science, or a related field.</li><li>At least 7 plus years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.</li><li>Strong SQL query writing skills and Excel.</li><li>Strong experience in documenting data requirements and source data information.</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI</li><li>Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL concepts.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.</li><li>Attention to detail and ability to work independently and as part of a team.<br></li></ul><strong>Nice to Have Skills &amp; Experience:-<br></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud-based data storage technologies, such SQL Server, Azure cloud storage</li><li>Experience with statistical analysis and data mining techniques.</li><li>Knowledge of data governance and regulatory compliance requirements.<br></li></ul>PSRTEK is a reputed technology recruitment and IT staffing brand with a global footprint and an admired client base. As an ideas and innovation powerhouse with a culture of excellence, we bring remarkable expertise and deliver powerfully transformative results.

title: Data Analyst
description: At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the various Life Sciences Industries.<p><br></p>We are much more than a consulting firm! Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and employer-based 401k contributions.<p><br></p><strong><u>We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following</u></strong><p><br></p>Job Title: Data Analyst<p><br></p>Location:<p><br></p>Lake County, IL USA<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>$54.00 per hour, Paid Time off, Company 401k contributions, Health, dental, and vision insurance.<p><br></p>Total Annual Compensation including benefits is $125,000.00<p><br></p>Resume Requirements<p><br></p>The following resume requirements must be met for resume to be considered<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Candidates first and last name (legal spelling) must be at the top of the resume<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Valid email address must be at the top of the resume.<p><br></p>LinkedIn links will not be accepted it must be a valid email address so our recruiters can respond to your resume<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Please refrain from submitting resumes with candidates photo they will not be considered<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for data modeling, Power BI dashboard creation and maintenance, ETL automation, ad-hoc reporting, and long term analytical and statistical projects. The Business Data Analyst will support cross-functional stakeholders and work with multiple sources and a wide range of data technologies and systems (e.g. SQL, Power BI, Hive, etc..)<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Years Of Experience/education And/or Certifcations Required</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>5+yrs most recent experience as a Data Analyst<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Primary Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Creating and maintaining data dictionaries, use cases, functional and non-functional requirements documents, test plans and other project documents<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Assisting with requirements facilitation and KPI definition/alignment<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Assisting with user acceptance testing<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Assisting with dashboard demos and feedback gathering<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Think strategically and analytically about business and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross functionally<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Ability to distill problem definitions, models, and constraints from informal business requirements<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Support key business systems and applications<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Further establish the newly implemented change management process<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Work in an ambiguous environment, drawing out and developing business requirements to meet changing needs<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Working with technical teams to capture data driven metrics<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or relevant work experience<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Advanced experience in Power BI<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other similar BI tools<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst Top Skills REQUIRED</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>3+ yrs Experience with Power BI<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrate deep understanding of source data from various internal/external systems.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Communicate and present findings to stakeholders<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience creating PowerPoints and Dashboards for leadership<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with development of metrics and business analytics, and have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, and a strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW) concepts, while dealing with ambiguity<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Should be able to work cohesively with stakeholders to understand business requirements and implement reporting solutions<p><br></p>Data Analyst Nice To Have Skills<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience using HIVE<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Tech startup looking for a Senior Data Analyst to provide data analysis and visualization for their healthcare clients nationwide!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Christine McNamara<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $75,000 - $90,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>SaaS based tech company that devotes their time to fostering a healthy and diverse work culture is actively looking to bring on a Data Analyst to join their team. They offer tons of room for career growth and advancement, so if you are looking for a role to move forward in your career- this is the role for you.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>100% coverage for medical, dental, and vision</li><li>401k with company match</li><li>Unlimited PTO</li><li>Flexible work schedule</li><li>Unlimited snacks</li><li>Company outings &amp; volunteering events</li><li>Gym Discounts</li><li>Annual performance bonuses</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelors degree in STEM related field</li><li> 2+ years of data visualization experience using Tableau, Qlik, Power BI or Looker</li><li> 1+ year of experience with analytics, database, or business intelligence in the healthcare field</li><li> Strong analytical aptitude and an understanding of statistical methods</li><li> Experience with statistical modeling tools using R, Python, or SAS</li><li> 1+ years of Strong SQL querying experience both creating and updating and stored procedures</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills</li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li> Desire to improve and expand analytical and data visualization skills with new technology</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Data Analyst, Operations Engineering
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Job Description<p><br></p>Data Analyst, Operations Engineering<p><br></p><strong><u>About Invenergy</u></strong><p><br></p>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<p><br></p>Position Overview<p><br></p>The Data Analyst, Operations Engineering primarily provides technical support to a large operating fleet of renewable energy projects by transforming data into actionable insights &amp; business intelligence, administering support for analytics tools and platforms, optimizing fleet performance, and guiding data-driven decisions.<p><br></p>Core Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Support cross-functional administrative &amp; operational needs for digital data &amp; analytics platform</li><li>Collaborate closely with operations engineering, asset management, and site technician teams</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Curate metrics, KPI’s, and reports that transform equipment information into operational intelligence<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage recurring reporting processes and identify actionable items</li><li>Perform ad-hoc analyses to quantify energy and revenue impact from operational events</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Design and maintain dashboards to drive actionable insights<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Support regulatory reporting requirements such as NERC GADS<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, engineering preferred<p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with Excel and Microsoft Office</li><li>Proficiency with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau</li><li>Strong communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with utility-scale wind, solar, natural gas, or battery storage technology and operations</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Familiarity with the OSIsoft PI software suite<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Familiarity with database environments &amp; query languages (SQL preferred)<p><br></p>+<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Familiarity with Python or other programming experience<p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), profit sharing, bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.<p><br></p>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.

operational needs for digital data &amp; analytics platform</li><li>Collaborate closely with operations engineering, asset management, and site technician teams</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Curate metrics, KPI’s, and reports that transform equipment information into operational intelligence<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage recurring reporting processes and identify actionable items</li><li>Perform ad-hoc analyses to quantify energy and revenue impact from operational events</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Design and maintain dashboards to drive actionable insights<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Support regulatory reporting requirements such as NERC GADS<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, engineering preferred<p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with Excel and Microsoft Office</li><li>Proficiency with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau</li><li>Strong communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with utility-scale wind, solar, natural gas, or battery storage technology and operations</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Familiarity with the OSIsoft PI software suite<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Familiarity with database environments &amp; query languages (SQL preferred)<p><br></p>+<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Familiarity with Python or other programming experience<p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), profit sharing, bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.<p><br></p>Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.

title: Data Analyst – Revenue Management
description: <strong>Job Title:</strong> Data Analyst – Revenue Management<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Bannockburn, IL (Candidates need to be local. Role is a hybrid of WFH and on-site for a few days per week.)<p><br></p><strong>Duration &amp; Type:</strong> Contract to hire – initial 3-month contract, then conversion to permanent employee.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong> Competitive hourly rate, Access to Healthcare, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plan of Choice, and 401K<p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors is currently seeking a Data Analyst for our direct client, a leader in the medical waste management industry. This is a contract to hire position with an initial 3-month contract, then conversion to permanent employee. The ideal candidate will build and use SQL queries to produce data from multiple internal sources that will support the work of the Revenue Realization Team in projects on an Ad Hoc Basis. Click apply now and join the Chamberlain experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Accountable For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build and use SQL queries to produce data from multiple internal sources that will support the work of the Revenue Realization Team in projects on an Ad Hoc Basis </li><li>Build data tracking and information spreadsheets for individual projects that allow input from Realization Team. </li><li>Produce documents and mass uploads that update pricing based on findings by Revenue Realization team to collect entitled revenues. </li><li>Producing reports and tracking process of Revenue Support Reps efforts to recover entitled revenues. </li><li>Self – Educated on other internal data sources as they are introduced with Stericycle, that will allow the Revenue Realization Team to expand their reach on Projects and collect additional entitled revenues in a accelerated manner. </li><li>Perform other duties and activities as assigned by Leadership. </li></ul> <strong>What Qualifications You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor of Science degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research) or the equivalent in related work experience </li><li>2+ years of recent experience as a Business or Sales Analyst </li><li>Billing and/or pricing experience preferred </li><li>2+ years of experience and knowledge building reports within a standard reporting application (i.e., SAP Business Objects, Cognos BI, SQL Reporting Services, etc.) and producing queries as needed from each of the data points and systems, along with ad hoc data marts for analysis using business intelligence tools (i.e., SQL, Alteryx, SSIS, etc.) </li><li>Experience with (understand, develop, and execute queries) SQL, SAP Hana Enterprise and relational databases preferred </li><li>Advanced in Excel (V Look-Up, Pivot Tables, Formulas, and other calculations) and comfortable using other Microsoft Office products </li><li>Willingness to expand upon known technical skills and continually develop/learn new technical skills in support of new tools/methods </li><li>Ability to work independently and manage several simultaneous projects with a focus on results </li><li>Experience in service business preferred, but not required </li></ul> <strong>About the Client</strong><p><br></p>Our client delivers solutions and drives innovations that protect the environment, people, and public health. This includes working to create a more sustainable, shared future. Their innovative solutions make a difference in people's lives, communities, and our planet by protecting their health and well-being. Change your career. Change your world. Join and help protect health and well-being in a safe, responsible, and sustainable way.<p><br></p><strong>Why Work with Chamberlain?</strong><p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors is a veteran-owned business that provides human capital solutions across a wide range of industries and engagement types. Chamberlain candidates benefit from our unique hiring and interviewing process which has been designed to increase the likelihood that they will be successful in their job searches. This is achieved through our 5-step recruitment process, ensuring a top-of-the-line candidate experience. Find out what makes us different; apply to Chamberlain today.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Chamberlain Advisors complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Advisors expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Chamberlain Advisors' employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.<p><br></p>

title: Data Engineer
description: <ul><li>We are looking for Data Engineer!</li><li> Responsibilities:</li><li>Designing, creating, and maintaining data processing systems </li><li>Analyzing and optimizing data processing workflows </li><li>Collaborating with the team to ensure data quality and efficiency </li><li>Testing and implementing new solutions </li><li> Requirements:</li><li>At least 2 years of experience in designing and creating data processing systems </li><li>Proficiency in tools and programming languages related to data engineering (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Scala, Python) </li><li>Excellent knowledge of databases and SQL language </li><li>Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively with other departments </li><li>Communicative English skills </li><li>Experience with AWS/AWS Glue is a plus </li><li> We offer:</li><li>B2B contract </li><li>Full-time job </li><li>Remote work and flexible hours </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>
description_json: <ul><li>We are looking for Data Engineer!</li><li> Responsibilities:</li><li>Designing, creating, and maintaining data processing systems </li><li>Analyzing and optimizing data processing workflows </li><li>Collaborating with the team to ensure data quality and efficiency </li><li>Testing and implementing new solutions </li><li> Requirements:</li><li>At least 2 years of experience in designing and creating data processing systems </li><li>Proficiency in tools and programming languages related to data engineering (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Scala, Python) </li><li>Excellent knowledge of databases and SQL language </li><li>Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively with other departments </li><li>Communicative English skills </li><li>Experience with AWS/AWS Glue is a plus </li><li> We offer:</li><li>B2B contract </li><li>Full-time job </li><li>Remote work and flexible hours </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Data Engineer
description: Position TitlePosition NumberLocation<p><br></p>Position Title:<p><br></p>Data Engineer<p><br></p>Position Number:<p><br></p>445557<p><br></p>Location:<p><br></p>USA, IL, Chicago 60601 Position TypeSkills/Attributes<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>Temporary<p><br></p>Skills/Attributes<p><br></p>Alteryx, PowerBI, SQL, Tableau Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>52<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p><strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>**Only those lawfully authorized to work in the designated country associated with the position will be considered.**</li><li>**Please note that all Position start dates and duration are estimates and may be reduced or lengthened based upon a client’s business needs and requirements.**</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Title: Data Engineer<p><br></p>Client Job ID: 15897<p><br></p>Duration: 12 Months<p><br></p>Location: Chicago, IL or Peoria, IL (Hybrid 1 day/week in office)<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p>The main function of a data engineer is to ensure that the data assets of an organization are supported by an architecture that supports the organization in achieving its strategic goal. A typical data engineer is responsible for setting enterprise standards for databases, data integration, and the means to get to the data.<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications.</li><li> Modify existing databases and database management systems or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.</li><li> Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.</li></ul><p><br></p>Typical task breakdown:<p><br></p>Job Duties:<p><br></p><ul><li> Use Tableau and Power BI to create solutions</li><li> Use Alteryx to combine data to support new dashboards</li><li> Manage multiple projects for customers simultaneously</li><li> Clearly communicate and document project progress, roadblocks, and anticipated timelines</li><li> Seek information about the real, underlying needs of their customers, beyond those expressed initially, and match those needs to available (or customized) products or services</li><li> This role will be responsible for managing tasks with varying timelines, including requesting support as needed. This may include getting clarity of requests from customers or guidance on data sources from teammates.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interaction with team:<p><br></p><ul><li> I hold weekly 1:1 meetings with all team members, and we have a weekly team meeting and code review. Our Team Lead is available for support as needed. We have in-person team meetings 2-3 times per year. Department and division meetings are held regularly.</li></ul><p><br></p>Work environment:<p><br></p><ul><li> Hybrid – must be onsite minimum one day per week or more as business needs dictate</li><li> Infrequent travel required (less than 10% of working time).</li></ul><p><br></p>CISD is a fast-moving division with Services Development providing support to a broad range of internal customers. We work hard and strive for excellence.<p><br></p>Education &amp; Experience Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> A combination of education and work experience (including internships) will be accepted so long as proficiency in technical skills can be demonstrated.</li><li> Minimum required: Associates degree plus 4 years’ experience OR Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years’ experience OR Master’s degree plus 2 internships</li></ul><p><br></p>Technical Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 1 year experience using each of the following tools:</li><li>Tableau</li><li>Power BI</li><li> Minimum 2 years’ experience in SQL</li><li> Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li> One year experience with:</li><li>Alteryx</li><li>Python</li><li>HTML</li></ul><p><br></p>Soft Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written English communication skills</li><li> Excellent time management skills</li><li> Confidence to request support as needed</li><li> A strong customer focus and awareness of company products and product applications</li><li> A proven track record of building cross-functional relationships with diversified departments</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li> Collaborative approach to teamwork</li><li> Willingness to share knowledge and support teammates on projects</li></ul><p><br></p>Disqualifiers/Red Flags:<p><br></p><ul><li> Inability to clearly communicate in English</li><li> Unwillingness to engage in team projects or support teammates with expertise</li></ul><p><br></p>Candidates must be in state of IL<p><br></p><strong>Benefits:<br><br>For information and details on employment benefits offered with this position, please visit here. Should you have any questions/concerns, please contact our HR Department via our secure website. <br><br></strong><strong>California Pay Equity:<br><br>For information and details on pay equity laws in California, please visit the State of California Department of Industrial Relations' website here. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances. <br><br></strong><strong>If you need assistance in completing this application, or during any phase of the application, interview, hiring, or employment process, whether due to a disability or otherwise, please contact our HR Department. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify). (Posting required by OCGA 13/10-91.).</strong>

title: Director Data Analysis- Marketing
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview:</u></strong><p><br></p>The Director of Data Analysis- Marketing is responsible for leading an organization that performs analytics and provides intelligence and/or recommendations to solve business issues to business partners. With a team of 15+, the incumbent develops the strategy for intelligence and issue resolution utilizing analytics including both qualitative and quantitative methods. The successful candidate will have strong stakeholder, people management and analytics experience.<p><br></p>They will partner with technology teams to identify, develop, and implement analytical tools that empowers the organization to provide high quality business intelligence.<p><br></p>Creates a culture of effective risk management, accountability, and demonstration of risk awareness across the organization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Has excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrates the value of analytical work through verbal communication, compelling presentations and data visualization suited to different levels of leadership.</li><li>Proactively identifies issues and problem solves them creatively. Demonstrates an ability to think strategically and outside the box while solving analytical problems or resolving issues.</li><li>Fosters a relationship of trust with stakeholders and proactively identifies opportunities to drive marketing strategy and support business growth.</li><li>Manages an analytics organization including hire/fire, performance reviews, assignment of work, and development decisions.</li><li>Has proven experience influencing business partners and senior leadership with strong analytics support and data driven solutions.</li><li>Understands P&amp;L dynamics, has in-depth experience with test designs and ability to translate test results into action. </li><li>Leads a team of experienced analysts to drive complex analytical solutions and data driven insights. Provides guidance to the team that aligns analytic activities with business goals.</li><li>Partners with technology teams to identify, develop, and implement core analytical tools and capabilities.</li><li>Develops and implements the organizational strategy for issue resolution utilizing analytics including both qualitative and quantitative methods.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor in Analytics, Information Technology, Economics or Engineering</li><li>8+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or Related</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>In Lieu of Education</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>10+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or related minimum</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>If we had our say, we’d also look for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Master in Analytics, Information Technology, Economics or Engineering preferred</li><li>10+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or related preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $147,000.00 to $223,400.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Energy Systems Analyst
description: Argonne National Laboratory is seeking a technically strong energy systems analyst in the area of life cycle assessment and technology assessment to quantify energy, environmental, and cost effects of energy systems and/or materials. This is a full-time staff position with the Systems Assessment Center’s Materials Life Cycle Group in the Energy Systems and Infrastructure Analysis Division. We are seeking applicants with strong technical background and expertise of alternative fuel and/or low-carbon material technologies that are promising for decarbonization of the transportation, manufacturing industry, and/or agriculture sectors. The Energy Systems Analyst will have an opportunity to work on research areas including renewable natural gas production and supply chain, waste-to-energy/product, CO2 capture and utilization, sustainable aviation fuels, sustainable and carbon-smart agricultural farming practices, waste utilization technologies for energy and material production, critical material production and supply chain, and/or industry materials and decarbonization technologies.<p><br></p>The Energy Systems Analyst will collect, synthesize, and process information to develop high-quality databases and derive data-driven results; work with other team members to develop and apply LCA methodologies to address critical analytical issues; provide rigorous and objective results; publish journal articles and reports; and present results to sponsors and at conferences, workshops, and project meetings.<p><br></p>The Energy Systems Analyst will analyze energy systems and/or material technologies, collect and synthesize datasets, provide rigorous and objective results, and contribute to Argonne’s GREET LCA model development and expansion. The Analyst will collect and synthesize data and information for specific energy system and/or material technology to conduct LCA studies in the GREET modeling platform and other analyses, process large datasets to derive results, communicate results through presentations, journal articles, and reports, and present results to sponsors and stakeholders at conferences, workshops, and project meetings. The Energy Systems Analyst will further develop the GREET model to provide quantitative results for the life-cycle energy consumption, greenhouse gas emissions, criteria air pollutant emissions, and water consumption across the life cycles of energy systems and/or materials. The candidate will work closely with collaborators from other national labs and academia to understand complex systems and to incorporate new data in analyses. The Energy Systems Analyst will also contribute to annual updates of the GREET model through working with other researchers in the group to incorporate new and updated energy system and/or material pathways into the GREET model.<p><br></p>The Materials Life Cycle Group supports DOE and other sponsors to assess the energy and environmental impacts associated with energy systems, materials, and integrated systems to help DOE and other stakeholders guide R&amp;D efforts, identify improvement opportunities, and to create new methodologies to address emerging issues in LCA/sustainability analysis.<p><br></p>The Systems Assessment Center continues a 30-year history of leadership in the field of life cycle analysis. The Energy Systems Analyst will join project teams including experts in a variety of topics and will regularly collaborate with experts in other Argonne groups as well as in industry and at other national laboratories. The Systems Assessment Center develops and maintains the <u>G</u>reenhouse Gases, <u>R</u>egulated <u>E</u>missions, and <u>E</u>nergy Use in <u>T</u>echnologies (GREET) model which is widely used by government, industry, and academic stakeholders to provide objective and rigorous results (see greet.es.anl.gov).<p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ph.D. degree in civil, chemical, mechanical engineering, environmental science/engineering, or related fields.</li><li>2-3 years of work experience in LCA or closely related area.</li><li>Expertise in topics related to process modeling and sustainability analysis of energy systems and/or materials.</li><li>Published peer-reviewed journal papers addressing environmental and sustainability performance and cost impacts of emerging energy systems and/or material technologies via LCA modeling and analysis.</li><li>Extensive experience in data-driven sustainability analysis.</li><li>Desire and passion to work as a part of a team in a highly collaborative environment.</li><li>Familiarity with a wide range of data sources relevant for environmental and sustainability analysis, and the ability to identify topics and data sources and engage experts to conduct research. Capable of identifying key features of complex systems/processes.</li><li>Well-developed problem-solving, systems thinking, quantitative, and critical thinking skills; intellectual curiosity. Able to structure and formulate solutions to complex problems.</li><li>Highly motivated attitude and detail-oriented approach with the ability to work independently to deliver. Energized by working as part of a highly collaborative and productive team.</li><li>Skilled written and verbal communicator, including the ability to present complex information so that it is understandable to a broad audience.</li><li>Breadth of knowledge in energy systems and/or critical materials and relevant issues.</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork. </li></ul><p><br></p><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with GREET and/or other LCA software such as openLCA preferred.</li><li>Computer programing skills relevant for data manipulation and analysis. Experience with creating and using complex data-driven analytical models in Excel with VBA scripting, and/or in open-source platforms using Python is preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><u>Uploads</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Curriculum Vitae</li><li>Writing Sample, e.g., journal articles or project reports</li><li>Undergraduate and Graduate School Transcripts, unofficial is acceptable for initial application</li><li>Names and contact information for four references</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Research Development (RD)<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Eng Systems Modeling-Simulation-Analysis 2<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em>

title: Systems Engineer
description: <strong>AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software. Our cutting-edge solutions are used by thousands of enterprises to deliver the essentials of life – such as energy, infrastructure, chemicals and minerals – safely, efficiently and more sustainably.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We’re the first software business in the world to have our sustainability targets validated by the SBTi, and we’ve been recognized for the transparency and ambition of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We’ve also recently been named as one of the world’s most innovative companies.</strong><p><br></p><strong>If you’re a curious and collaborative person who wants to make a big impact through technology, then we want to hear from you! Find out more at https://www.aveva.com/en/about/careers/.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Salary Range:</strong><p><br></p>$78,000.00 - $130,200.00<p><br></p><strong>About the Role:</strong><p><br></p>We are hiring for the role of Systems Engineer reporting to the Technical Adoption Services team, part of the Customer Success group. AVEVA Technical Adoption Services team, a knowledge center within AVEVA, helps shape our customers vision of how the PI System infrastructure supports and enhances business drivers and goals. The Systems Engineer ensures customer success by delivering exceptional outcome-based services to PI Users in support and enablement of those business goals. Systems Engineers use best practices, technical knowledge, and their industry expertise, to deliver services to our EA customers, as well as into a broader scope within the AVEVA customer base and sales activities.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Lead workshops and coaching sessions to guide the customer in using the PI System successfully to realize their use cases.</li><li>Lead conversations to help focus the vision where the PI System adds business value, at all customer levels. Examples include Administration/IT Staff, Operations Management and Staff, "C" level executives.</li><li>Lead strategic conversation with customers to guide them through use case discovery and position OSIsoft Products and Infrastructure to address those needs.</li><li>Act as technical liaison to assigned customer accounts, working with Customer Success Managers, to maximize customer value and drive new business.</li><li>Have a strong interest in growing your career and participating in both internal and external training programs to keep abreast of emerging technologies and markets.</li><li>Display initiative and self-motivation to deliver high quality results along with meeting all expectations for both internal and external customers.</li><li>Influence and drive adoption of the PI Infrastructure through product demonstration, Proof of Value, and other promotional activities.</li><li>Assist with risk vs. benefit analysis to help the customer understand ramifications of various deployment options.</li><li>Proactively engage Enterprise Customers to promote enterprise wide adoption and implementation of the PI Infrastructure.</li><li>Mentor other team members on industry, product, and/or technology topics.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering or another technical field</li><li>5+ yrs. experience with real-time operational data systems within an industrial manufacturing and/or operating industry.</li><li>Hands on PI System experience, highly desired</li><li>Strong leadership, customer service, and interpersonal relationship skills</li><li>Solid oral, written, presentation, and communication skills</li><li>Ability to work as part of a team to solve problems and share best practices</li><li>Ability to set priorities and manage multiple activities</li><li>Experience working with C-level executives, a plus</li><li>A background in architectures and enterprise-wide design methodologies, a plus</li><li>Willing and able to travel for up to 50%</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.</strong><p><br></p><strong>AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.<br><br>Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.</strong>

and drive new business.</li><li>Have a strong interest in growing your career and participating in both internal and external training programs to keep abreast of emerging technologies and markets.</li><li>Display initiative and self-motivation to deliver high quality results along with meeting all expectations for both internal and external customers.</li><li>Influence and drive adoption of the PI Infrastructure through product demonstration, Proof of Value, and other promotional activities.</li><li>Assist with risk vs. benefit analysis to help the customer understand ramifications of various deployment options.</li><li>Proactively engage Enterprise Customers to promote enterprise wide adoption and implementation of the PI Infrastructure.</li><li>Mentor other team members on industry, product, and/or technology topics.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering or another technical field</li><li>5+ yrs. experience with real-time operational data systems within an industrial manufacturing and/or operating industry.</li><li>Hands on PI System experience, highly desired</li><li>Strong leadership, customer service, and interpersonal relationship skills</li><li>Solid oral, written, presentation, and communication skills</li><li>Ability to work as part of a team to solve problems and share best practices</li><li>Ability to set priorities and manage multiple activities</li><li>Experience working with C-level executives, a plus</li><li>A background in architectures and enterprise-wide design methodologies, a plus</li><li>Willing and able to travel for up to 50%</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.</strong><p><br></p><strong>AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.<br><br>Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.</strong>

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: <strong>Merge Storytelling and Technology</strong><p><br></p>We MERGE storytelling and technology to promote health, wealth and happiness in the world. We help marketing and technology executives engage hearts and connect parts by offering full-service capabilities including strategy, creative communications, experience engineering, performance marketing, media, digital platform development and more.<p><br></p><strong>Promote Health, Wealth &amp; Happiness</strong><p><br></p>We are committed to promoting health, wealth and happiness in the world by partnering with purpose-driven clients in purpose-driven industries such as healthcare, financial services and consumer products. Our health clients are literally on the front lines saving lives. Our wealth clients are changing the financial potential in people's lives. And our consumer clients make lives...a little bit happier every day.<p><br></p><strong>Partner with Clients of Iconic Brands</strong><p><br></p>MERGE has enduring client partnerships with American Express, T-Mobile, LG, Facebook, Adobe, Kate Spade NY, Coach, The North Face, Fidelity, Eaton Vance, BlueCross BlueShield, Abbott, Astellas, Seqirus, Supernus, Boston Scientific, Advocate Aurora Health, Indiana University Health and Marco’s Pizza to name a few.<p><br></p><strong>Work with Poets and PHD’s</strong><p><br></p>With 750+ employees across offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Denver, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Montreal and New York City, MERGE uses a talent-to-task process that connects our poets and PHD’s which enables clients to think higher and feel deeper about their customers.<p><br></p><strong>Emerge to the Top of Your Career</strong><p><br></p>At MERGE, we strive to create a superior work experience where people with ability, agility and humility can grow and do the best work of their careers.<p><br></p><strong>As our Web Analytics Developer, you will…</strong><p><br></p><strong>Be Accountable and Responsible</strong><p><br></p>We are looking to add an experienced JavaScript developer to our Analytics Solutions Design team. This individual will be focused on assisting our clients and web development teams in building and maintaining data layers for multiple analytics tools and tag management systems.<p><br></p>This individual will help populate data layer variables with dynamic values, assist in implementing analytics code within eCommerce platforms such as Shopify, BigCommerce, and others; as well as bringing custom values into analytics and marketing tags.<p><br></p><strong>These Are The Qualifications We’re Looking For</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 1-2 years of experience in manipulating web documents and elements via javascript </li><li> At least 1 year of experience building data layers for multiple tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium, and Adobe Launch </li><li> At least 1 year of experience creating data layer documentation &amp; pushes to populate variables dynamically </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000</strong><p><br></p>Salary differential is based on seniority, merit, education, training, and experience. MERGE’s career ladders reflect department growth from Associate through Partner levels, with details of roles and responsibilities associated with each level. New hires are assigned a job level within a particular position based on these criteria and salary is set within the job level based on these criteria. Growth from one level to the next occurs when employees master their role and are promoted to the next level, generally during salary review cycles that are posted in the employee handbook.<p><br></p><strong>And here’s how we live our values at MERGE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability. Mastering our craft</li><li>Agility. Delivering with a growth mindset</li><li>Humility. Collaborating for shared success</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>MERGE is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer </strong><p><br></p>MERGE welcomes and celebrates diversity regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status or people with abilities. We believe that the more diverse we are, the more creative our work will be!<p><br></p>

title: Web Analytics Developer
description: Contingent Reason for Request         External Worker Needed        If Contract to Hire, Please Enter Expected Salary         N/A        Worker Type         C        Please list any other Client locations that the contractor can work from, if applicable         Naperville, IL; Richardson, TX        Required Qualification(s)         WAS/Tomcat/JBoss admin skills and linux system admin knowledge as plus        Preferred Qualification(s)         (No Value)    <br> Infrastructure Engineer<br> <br> Open Bid<br> <br> onsite hybrid: Chicago/Richardson/Naperville<br> <br> Job responsibilities will include the following: Installation and configuration of WebSphere Application Server, deploying enterprise applications, configuring or modifying platform, proactively monitoring the health of environment, configuring and managing the security of the platform. Job will also entail monitoring, optimizing, tuning and troubleshooting WebSphere applications. The successful candidate will be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in WAS/Tomcat/JBoss and their related components. The candidate will be a self-motivated individual who works well with groups and independently with minimal supervision to achieve stated goals and project tasks.<br> <br> Required Job Qualifications:<br> * Excellent knowleddge of administrating WebSphere Application Server/Tomcat/JBoss servers<br> * Infrastructure Automation (such ansible tool preferred)<br> * Operations Management and IT standards, procedures, and policies<br> * Experts level knowledge of IBM WAS/Tomcat/JBoss in design, installation, fixpack upgrade, migration, and configuration<br> * Experts level knowledge with WAS Clienttal/vertical Clustering<br> * Ability to simplify &amp; standardize complex concepts / processes<br> * Understanding of business priorities (e.g., vision), trends (e.g., industry knowledge) and markets (e.g., existing/ planned)<br> * Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are required; teamwork and collaboration<br> * Problem solving / analytical skills, tools and techniques with experience in troubleshooting WAS/Tomcat/JBoss issues as well as other complex performance issues<br> * Ability to create long and short term plan and prioritize tasks and make trade-off decisions<br> * Ability to drive cross functional executions and manage project schedule<br> * Adaptability and ability to introduce / manage change with ServiceNow and Jari<br> * Basic understanding of AIX/RedHat/Windows administration and including basic Client scripting

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Position TitlePosition NumberLocation<p><br></p>Position Title:<p><br></p>Application Developer/ Data Engineer<p><br></p>Position Number:<p><br></p>445573<p><br></p>Location:<p><br></p>USA, IL, Chicago 60603 Position TypeSkills/Attributes<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>Temporary<p><br></p>Skills/Attributes<p><br></p>Application Architecture, Azure, DevOps, Microservices, Python, React, SQL Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>40<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p><strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Client: Northern Trust<p><br></p>Job Title: Application Developer/Data Engineer<p><br></p>Number of Positions: 1<p><br></p>Job ID: 100135-1<p><br></p>Duration: 1 year<p><br></p>Location: Chicago IL 60603<p><br></p>Vendor Notes :<p><br></p>Azure Cloud Engineer who has Portfolio Management/ Trading /Financial industry background with experience in App Stack (must have some/all) - Python/Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Functions/ Azure Data Lake<p><br></p>Looking for a motivated and experienced technical leader to be a key player in changing how we deliver technology for our Asset Management &amp; Investment Services business. This person will have direct and far reaching impact on Cloud adoption, Agile/DevOps maturity. The role requires working across a broad spectrum of technology, development teams and business partners. There could not be a better time to join our team as we transform how we deliver technology.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as the primary expert for Azure based solutions to our Investment Management teams. Stay educated and up-to-date as to the latest changes</li><li> Self-starter who can pick up new technologies/skills, be comfortable with ambiguity and drive initiatives forward</li><li> Identify end to end solutions, leverage best practices and patterns</li><li> Create Proof of Concepts, apply existing technologies in new ways, prove out new approaches and technologies</li><li> Provides technical governance and guidance in partnership with application development teams</li><li> Researches, models, and integrates business and technology architectures to align with business strategy, goals and objectives</li><li> Consults on a wide spectrum of existing and emerging technologies</li><li> Reviews high-risk technology projects for compatibility with IT standards and strategic direction</li><li> Develop and execute machine learning models on the NTAM Azure cloud platform to serve business goals</li><li> Help define and execute the strategic vision for data science and predictive modeling to meet the vast pent-up demand of our business</li><li> Nurture junior data scientists to help them achieve their best</li><li> Improve the maturity of data driven decision making, and bring actionable insights to our business</li><li> Create machine learning POCs and present them to NTAM executives; this requires an understanding of the business problem and leading with hypotheses to appropriately structure the data &amp; model</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor''s degree or equivalent work experience</li><li> 5+ years’ experience with the concepts, philosophies and tools behind the design of applications, information and underlying information technologies</li><li> 10+ years’ core application development experience. Implementing applications and end to end solutions/designs.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Skills/Experience:<p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years coming in a lead Application Architect/Senior Application Developer role</li><li> Strong interpersonal skills with excellent verbal and written communication</li><li> Collaborative style with an ability to achieve consensus</li><li> Proven technical leader</li><li> Design of an application’s code base, layering, componentization, framework selection</li><li> App Stack (must have some/all) - Python, REST, Microservice, React</li><li> Cloud (Desired) – Microsoft Azure</li><li> Delivery (Required) – proven track record with CI/CD, Agile/DevOps</li><li> Database experience (Preferred) - SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, data delivery</li><li> Messaging Middleware – IBM MQ/ Solace/ Kafka(desirable)</li><li> End to end system solutioning/exposure…Security, Performance, Availability, Scalability.</li><li> Information Security and Financial Services domain knowledge a big plus</li><li> Experience building applications and/or running machine learning models on public cloud based platforms such as (preferably) Azure Stack (Azure Machine Learning/ Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Data Lake)</li><li> Experience in using a shared code base and version control using GIT</li><li> Experience in deploying models and/or applications from a development to production environment using CI/CD pipelines</li><li> Advanced programmatic data visualization skills in Python (Seaborn, Plot.ly, etc), Javascript/HTML/CSS, or R</li><li> Familiarity with database topics such as SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, and data delivery</li><li> Understanding of the SCRUM Agile process</li><li> Financial Services domain knowledge</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits:<br><br>For information and details on employment benefits offered with this position, please visit here. Should you have any questions/concerns, please contact our HR Department via our secure website. <br><br></strong><strong>California Pay Equity:<br><br>For information and details on pay equity laws in California, please visit the State of California Department of Industrial Relations' website here. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances. <br><br></strong><strong>If you need assistance in completing this application, or during any phase of the application, interview, hiring, or employment process, whether due to a disability or otherwise, please contact our HR Department. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify). (Posting required by OCGA 13/10-91.).</strong>

title: Application Developer/ Data Engineer
description: At our digital media company, we're passionate about connecting consumers with the world's leading brands. With a diverse portfolio of brands and technologies, we strive to be the most innovative and tech-enabled media company out there. Our headquarters is located in vibrant downtown Delray Beach, Florida, and our dynamic team spans across over a dozen countries. We attribute our success to our energetic culture and a high-performing, entrepreneurial spirit.<br><br>YOUR ROLE<br><br>We're in search of a highly motivated and data-driven professional to join our credit cards vertical. As a key member of our team, you'll leverage your analytical skills to optimize and manage the daily operations of the business. Reporting directly to the VP of Operations &amp; Growth, you'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to optimize campaigns and ensure the success of the vertical.<br><br>As the subject matter expert in this vertical, you'll be responsible for standardizing reporting and conducting ad hoc analysis to identify growth opportunities. Your ability to deliver insightful, accurate, and actionable data insights through strategic partnerships will earn you the team's confidence and directly impact your success.<br><br>SUCCESS IN THIS ROLE MEANS<br><br>Analyzing and interpreting digital marketing data across various channels, website performance, and advertiser conversion to proactively suggest improvements and boost ROI.<br><br>Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including paid media, content, design, and product, to develop and implement data-driven marketing initiatives aligned with business goals.<br><br>Assisting in the execution of A/B testing plans to optimize website performance, media buying, and other digital marketing strategies.<br><br>Managing marketplace operations, monitoring KPIs throughout the entire sales funnel, tracking volume trends, and updating forecasting models.<br><br>Optimizing business performance and creating forward-looking projections to drive growth in the Credit Card vertical.<br><br>Tracking advertiser performance, conducting product analysis, cross-category comparisons, and monitoring partner key success metrics.<br><br>Compiling business proposals and partner-facing materials by pulling and analyzing relevant data sets.<br><br>Building reports and dashboards to support compliance, account management, and marketing teams.<br><br>Conducting regular competitive analysis to identify industry trends and opportunities.<br><br>Effectively communicating updates and changes to the team.<br><br>Contributing to ad-hoc analytical projects.<br><br><strong><u>What You Need To Succeed<br><br></u></strong>1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing analyst role, preferably within the financial services industry.<br><br>Bachelor's degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.<br><br>Proven experience working with complex data sets.<br><br>Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Experience in a similar role involving business analytics and operations management.<br><br>Expertise in Excel and/or Google Sheets, including pivot tables and advanced formulas.<br><br>NICE TO HAVES<br><br>Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, or other reporting and analytics tools, including report and dashboard creation.<br><br>Proficiency in SQL, SSAS, or other database/analysis packages.<br><br>Familiarity with performance marketing and lead generation.<br><br>Previous experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.<br><br>Ready to make an impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!<br><br>We've always been committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive team and culture since day one. As an Equal Employment Opportunity company, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 39,000.00 121,000.00 Per Year

ROLE MEANS<br><br>Analyzing and interpreting digital marketing data across various channels, website performance, and advertiser conversion to proactively suggest improvements and boost ROI.<br><br>Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including paid media, content, design, and product, to develop and implement data-driven marketing initiatives aligned with business goals.<br><br>Assisting in the execution of A/B testing plans to optimize website performance, media buying, and other digital marketing strategies.<br><br>Managing marketplace operations, monitoring KPIs throughout the entire sales funnel, tracking volume trends, and updating forecasting models.<br><br>Optimizing business performance and creating forward-looking projections to drive growth in the Credit Card vertical.<br><br>Tracking advertiser performance, conducting product analysis, cross-category comparisons, and monitoring partner key success metrics.<br><br>Compiling business proposals and partner-facing materials by pulling and analyzing relevant data sets.<br><br>Building reports and dashboards to support compliance, account management, and marketing teams.<br><br>Conducting regular competitive analysis to identify industry trends and opportunities.<br><br>Effectively communicating updates and changes to the team.<br><br>Contributing to ad-hoc analytical projects.<br><br><strong><u>What You Need To Succeed<br><br></u></strong>1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing analyst role, preferably within the financial services industry.<br><br>Bachelor's degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.<br><br>Proven experience working with complex data sets.<br><br>Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Experience in a similar role involving business analytics and operations management.<br><br>Expertise in Excel and/or Google Sheets, including pivot tables and advanced formulas.<br><br>NICE TO HAVES<br><br>Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, or other reporting and analytics tools, including report and dashboard creation.<br><br>Proficiency in SQL, SSAS, or other database/analysis packages.<br><br>Familiarity with performance marketing and lead generation.<br><br>Previous experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.<br><br>Ready to make an impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!<br><br>We've always been committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive team and culture since day one. As an Equal Employment Opportunity company, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 39,000.00 121,000.00 Per Year

title: Entry Level Software Programmer (Remote)
description: <strong><u>Junior Front End Developer Position Overview<br><br></u></strong>Our client is currently looking to fill a new Front End Developer position. This job will involve primarily working with the Mendix Enterprise Application cloud system with some experience with providing rapid customer solutions for various business needs. You will work with our business team to find out what their needs are. You will be assisting with analysis of the business teams requirements and advise them accordingly. Together with your project team, you will be responsible for the development, and implementation of the system.<br><br>Duties and Responsibilities<br><ul><li> Development of high-quality applications in small teams with Front End development</li><li> Deduce and document use cases from customer requirements</li><li> Visual Modeling: Develop application workflows, Create integration interfaces via Web Services, Create Graphical User Interface Layouts.</li><li> Integration interfaces with custom JavaScript</li><li> Documentation of either or, user manuals, (non-)functional application requirements, business processes, work flows, project plans and planning, systems architecture, etc.</li><li> Ability to replicate UI/UX design in their development</li><li> Mendix Experience is a nice to have Skills / Attributes Required</li><li> Expertise with web client languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)</li><li> Familiarity with web client frameworks (React or Angular)</li><li> Experience with source code management (Git is a plus)</li><li> Object oriented design skills and familiarity with JavaScript a plus Profile</li><li> 2 to 3 years of work experience in IT development and delivery.</li><li> Experience in customer-facing environments, with daily customer interaction.</li><li> Familiar with Agile practices.</li><li> Experience with both business and IT units</li><li> Eager to learn new technologies.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills.</li><li> Enthusiastic, creative and flexible.</li><li> Great communicative skills.<br></li></ul>#TECH2022

title: Front End Web Developer - Junior
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ansible Tower / Automation Platform installation and administration skills on physical and OpenShift deployments</li><li>Experience writing Playbooks and assisting others in their automation journey.</li><li>Strong Linux skills</li><li>Python, Bash, YAML, Groovy, Ruby, Java, PowerShell scripting experience</li><li>Additional skills include vRealize Automation, Chef, NSX, Vault, GitHub, and Jira experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
