title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle for Unix/Linux server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to: Linux and AIX operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, and x86 hardware solutions. Interfaces with Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support</li><li>Participates in Agile product meetings, deployments, and related tasks.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and is actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Red Hat Certified System Architect (RHCSA)</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle for Unix/Linux server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to: Linux and AIX operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, and x86 hardware solutions. Interfaces with Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support</li><li>Participates in Agile product meetings, deployments, and related tasks.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and is actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Red Hat Certified System Architect (RHCSA)</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Golang programing language</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Linux administration/scripting skillset</li><li>AWS – RDS</li><li>Git/GitHub, Jenkins CI/CD</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Middleware Engineer
description: <strong><u>Junior Front End Developer Position Overview<br><br></u></strong>Our client is currently looking to fill a new Front End Developer position. This job will involve primarily working with the Mendix Enterprise Application cloud system with some experience with providing rapid customer solutions for various business needs. You will work with our business team to find out what their needs are. You will be assisting with analysis of the business teams requirements and advise them accordingly. Together with your project team, you will be responsible for the development, and implementation of the system.<br><br>Duties and Responsibilities<br><ul><li> Development of high-quality applications in small teams with Front End development</li><li> Deduce and document use cases from customer requirements</li><li> Visual Modeling: Develop application workflows, Create integration interfaces via Web Services, Create Graphical User Interface Layouts.</li><li> Integration interfaces with custom JavaScript</li><li> Documentation of either or, user manuals, (non-)functional application requirements, business processes, work flows, project plans and planning, systems architecture, etc.</li><li> Ability to replicate UI/UX design in their development</li><li> Mendix Experience is a nice to have Skills / Attributes Required</li><li> Expertise with web client languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)</li><li> Familiarity with web client frameworks (React or Angular)</li><li> Experience with source code management (Git is a plus)</li><li> Object oriented design skills and familiarity with JavaScript a plus Profile</li><li> 2 to 3 years of work experience in IT development and delivery.</li><li> Experience in customer-facing environments, with daily customer interaction.</li><li> Familiar with Agile practices.</li><li> Experience with both business and IT units</li><li> Eager to learn new technologies.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills.</li><li> Enthusiastic, creative and flexible.</li><li> Great communicative skills.<br></li></ul>#TECH2022

Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong>: Employer will accept a degree in Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering (any) or related field and 36 months of experience in Lead DevOps Engineer; Senior Software Engineer; Systems Engineer or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: Developing, releasing, and building engineering utilizing DevOps methodology; Utilizing programming languages, including Groovy and scripting tools, including Linux, Bash, and Python; Utilizing Docker and Kubernetes; Utilizing Jenkins for orchestration of Continuous Integration Continuous Deployment (CI/CD), GitHub as version control system, Nexus packages, Artifactory as a private registry for Docker images, Xray for vulnerability scanner, and SonarQube for code quality; Developing declarative style pipeline as code for various application types for CI/CD; Developing infrastructure as code, Terraform modules, and Ansible playbooks for automation; Monitoring cloud native applications deployed in Openshift; Developing software utilizing Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, and Kubernetes Operators; and Visualizing and documenting architecture and design topology.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $86,174 to $142,500. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Application Developer - Chicago<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an application developer as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. The application developer will perform development for our no code / low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. The developer will work on a dynamic development team in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver a customized solution for our clients.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>The Application Developer will need to have:<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>3- B years of experience in software development, preferably in a C- 3, JavaScript, .NET, and SQL Server environment.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>1- B years of experience with Node.js, GoJs, Angular, or similar technologies.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Bachelor'2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other field.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.<p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these qualities:<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<p><br></p>We Offer You<p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include</u></strong><p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>*Secret Clearance Required to Be Considered*<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: Application Developer
description: <span><span>Looking for a motivated and experienced technical leader to be a key player in changing how we deliver technology for our Asset Management &amp; Investment Services business. This person will have direct and far reaching impact on Cloud adoption, Agile/DevOps maturity. There could not be a better time to join our team as we transform how we deliver technology. <span>Inviting applications for the role of <strong>Azure Cloud Engineer.<br><br></strong></span><strong>Key Skills: Azure Cloud Engineer who has Portfolio Management/ Trading /Financial industry background with experience in App Stack (must have some/all) - Python/Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Functions/ Azure Data Lake<br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Serve as the primary expert for Azure based solutions to our Investment Management teams. Stay educated and up-to-date as to the latest changes</span></span></li><li><span><span>Self-starter who can pick up new technologies/skills, be comfortable with ambiguity and drive initiatives forward</span></span></li><li><span><span>Identify end to end solutions, leverage best practices and patterns</span></span></li><li><span><span>Create Proof of Concepts, apply existing technologies in new ways, prove out new approaches and technologies</span></span></li><li><span><span>Provides technical governance and guidance in partnership with application development teams</span></span></li><li><span><span>Researches, models, and integrates business and technology architectures to align with business strategy, goals and objectives</span></span></li><li><span><span>Consults on a wide spectrum of existing and emerging technologies</span></span></li><li><span><span>Reviews high-risk technology projects for compatibility with IT standards and strategic direction</span></span></li><li><span><span>Develop and execute machine learning models on the NTAM Azure cloud platform to serve business goals</span></span></li><li><span><span>Help define and execute the strategic vision for data science and predictive modeling to meet the vast pent-up demand of our business</span></span></li><li><span><span>Nurture junior data scientists to help them achieve their best</span></span></li><li><span><span>Improve the maturity of data driven decision making, and bring actionable insights to our business</span></span></li><li><span><span>Create machine learning POCs and present them to NTAM executives; this requires an understanding of the business problem and leading with hypotheses to appropriately structure the data &amp; model</span></span></li></ul><span><span><strong>Basic Qualifications</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience</span></span></li><li><span><span>5+ years experience with the concepts, philosophies and tools behind the design of applications, information and underlying information technologies</span></span></li><li><span><span>10+ years core application development experience. Implementing applications and end to end solutions/designs.</span></span></li></ul><span><span><strong>Preferred Skills/Experience:</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>5+ years coming in a lead Application Architect/Senior Application Developer role</span></span></li><li><span><span>Strong interpersonal skills with excellent verbal and written communication</span></span></li><li><span><span>Collaborative style with an ability to achieve consensus</span></span></li><li><span><span>Proven technical leader</span></span></li><li><span><span>Design of an applications code base, layering, componentization, framework selection</span></span></li><li><span><span>App Stack (must have some/all) - Python, REST, Microservice, React</span></span></li><li><span><span>Cloud (Desired) Microsoft Azure</span></span></li><li><span><span>Delivery (Required) proven track record with CI/CD, Agile/DevOps</span></span></li><li><span><span>Database experience (Preferred) - SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, data delivery</span></span></li><li><span><span>Messaging Middleware IBM MQ/ Solace/ Kafka(desirable)</span></span></li><li><span><span>End to end system solutioning/exposureSecurity, Performance, Availability, Scalability.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Information Security and Financial Services domain knowledge a big plus</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience building applications and/or running machine learning models on public cloud based platforms such as (preferably) Azure Stack (Azure Machine Learning/ Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Data Lake)</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in using a shared code base and version control using GIT</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in deploying models and/or applications from a development to production environment using CI/CD pipelines</span></span></li><li><span><span>Advanced programmatic data visualization skills in Python (Seaborn, Plot.ly, etc), Javascript/HTML/CSS, or R</span></span></li><li><span><span>Familiarity with database topics such as SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, and data delivery</span></span></li><li><span><span>Understanding of the SCRUM Agile process</span></span></li><li><span><span>Financial Services domain knowledge</span></span></li></ul><span><span>Please share your resume at rsharma@prairieinc.com. Thanks!</span></span>

SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, data delivery</span></span></li><li><span><span>Messaging Middleware IBM MQ/ Solace/ Kafka(desirable)</span></span></li><li><span><span>End to end system solutioning/exposureSecurity, Performance, Availability, Scalability.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Information Security and Financial Services domain knowledge a big plus</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience building applications and/or running machine learning models on public cloud based platforms such as (preferably) Azure Stack (Azure Machine Learning/ Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Data Lake)</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in using a shared code base and version control using GIT</span></span></li><li><span><span>Experience in deploying models and/or applications from a development to production environment using CI/CD pipelines</span></span></li><li><span><span>Advanced programmatic data visualization skills in Python (Seaborn, Plot.ly, etc), Javascript/HTML/CSS, or R</span></span></li><li><span><span>Familiarity with database topics such as SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, and data delivery</span></span></li><li><span><span>Understanding of the SCRUM Agile process</span></span></li><li><span><span>Financial Services domain knowledge</span></span></li></ul><span><span>Please share your resume at rsharma@prairieinc.com. Thanks!</span></span>

title: Middleware Engineer
description: Contingent Reason for Request         External Worker Needed        If Contract to Hire, Please Enter Expected Salary         N/A        Worker Type         C        Please list any other Client locations that the contractor can work from, if applicable         Naperville, IL; Richardson, TX        Required Qualification(s)         WAS/Tomcat/JBoss admin skills and linux system admin knowledge as plus        Preferred Qualification(s)         (No Value)    <br> Infrastructure Engineer<br> <br> Open Bid<br> <br> onsite hybrid: Chicago/Richardson/Naperville<br> <br> Job responsibilities will include the following: Installation and configuration of WebSphere Application Server, deploying enterprise applications, configuring or modifying platform, proactively monitoring the health of environment, configuring and managing the security of the platform. Job will also entail monitoring, optimizing, tuning and troubleshooting WebSphere applications. The successful candidate will be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in WAS/Tomcat/JBoss and their related components. The candidate will be a self-motivated individual who works well with groups and independently with minimal supervision to achieve stated goals and project tasks.<br> <br> Required Job Qualifications:<br> * Excellent knowleddge of administrating WebSphere Application Server/Tomcat/JBoss servers<br> * Infrastructure Automation (such ansible tool preferred)<br> * Operations Management and IT standards, procedures, and policies<br> * Experts level knowledge of IBM WAS/Tomcat/JBoss in design, installation, fixpack upgrade, migration, and configuration<br> * Experts level knowledge with WAS Clienttal/vertical Clustering<br> * Ability to simplify &amp; standardize complex concepts / processes<br> * Understanding of business priorities (e.g., vision), trends (e.g., industry knowledge) and markets (e.g., existing/ planned)<br> * Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are required; teamwork and collaboration<br> * Problem solving / analytical skills, tools and techniques with experience in troubleshooting WAS/Tomcat/JBoss issues as well as other complex performance issues<br> * Ability to create long and short term plan and prioritize tasks and make trade-off decisions<br> * Ability to drive cross functional executions and manage project schedule<br> * Adaptability and ability to introduce / manage change with ServiceNow and Jari<br> * Basic understanding of AIX/RedHat/Windows administration and including basic Client scripting

title: Java Engineer (W2)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Infrastructure Developer Specialist; Senior Infrastructure Developer; Tech Lead; Technical Lead or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: providing technical direction in design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD platform components, including Jenkins, GitHub, Nexus, and SonarQube; developing and releasing infrastructure as a code with DevOps methodology for automation; working with Docker and Kubernetes to create highly available and scalable CI/CD solutions; designing and implementing backup and disaster strategies for CI/CD tools; developing self-service utilities to perform CICD tool administrative activities; providing best practices to address any audit and security issues; and designing and configuring automation scripts to monitor CI/CD tool infrastructure resources and its availability.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong><u>About Grainger</u></strong><p><br></p>Grainger is a leading broad line distributor with operations primarily in North America, Japan and the United Kingdom. We achieve our purpose, We Keep the World Working®, by serving more than 4.5 million customers with a wide range of products that keep their operations running and their people safe. Grainger also delivers services and solutions, such as technical support and inventory management, to save customers time and money.<p><br></p>We're looking for passionate people who can move our company forward. As one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For, we have a welcoming workplace where you can build a career for yourself while fulfilling our purpose to keep the world working. We embrace new ways of thinking and recognize everyone is an individual. Find your way with Grainger today.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Details</u></strong><p><br></p>You will drive incremental e-commerce and digital sales with international strategic resellers and marketplaces.<p><br></p>These reseller and marketplace Opportunities will generally represent sales opportunities greater than $1M in potential sales growth. Responsible for the identification, evaluation, development and management of digital channel partner relationships. Collaborates with internal business partners to execute a strategic sales process for uncovering new digital business opportunities and developing and maintaining an adequate pipeline of potential sales to meet digital global export expectations.<p><br></p><strong><u>You Will</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop and implement sales programs and plans for the strategic reseller offering and international marketplaces to drive company sales objectives.</li><li> Provide functional direction and personal involvement to support the Field in the planning, reach and barrier removal within customer sites.</li><li> Improve and maintain rate of growth with existing reseller accounts and develop new - strategies with targeted accounts and customer segments.</li><li> Evaluate, negotiate and direct the development, maintenance, or discontinuation of reseller agreements through the contract renewal process.</li><li> Negotiate profitable opportunities with existing strategic resellers for Grainger Industrial supply.</li><li> Develop and implement value-added programs and measurements that align the customer’s our goals with Grainger’s value proposition and customer initiatives.</li><li> Provide visible leadership and facilitation of the sales management process to create improved revenues and earnings</li><li> Provide leadership in change management methodology within the company and throughout the customer’s organization.</li><li> Create and manage strong relationship plan with internal partners.</li><li> Work/lead cross functional teams to review product and service needs across our customers.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Sales, Operations or Management or equivalent work experience required.</li><li> 5+ years of business experience to include 1+ years of digital business development experience (Channel related experience preferred).</li><li> Demonstrated project management skills.</li><li> Financial acumen/ ability to manage budgets and understand financial models.</li><li> Ability to operate in matrix-managed environment (directing and coordinating others outside department).</li><li> Proven experience in identifying, negotiating, structuring, competing and implementing digital joint partnership agreements.</li><li> International experience ideal</li><li> Experience with SAP</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Rewards And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>With benefits starting day one, Grainger is committed to your safety, health and wellbeing. Our programs provide choice to meet our team members' individual needs. Check out some of the rewards available to you at Grainger.<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage starts day one</li><li>Paid time off (PTO) days and 6 company holidays per year</li><li>6% 401(k) company contribution each pay period</li><li>Education assistance, including financial counseling, tuition reimbursement and low-cost degree options</li><li>Employee discounts, parental leave, and more</li></ul><p><br></p>DEI Statement<p><br></p><em>We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.</em>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Job Title:</strong> Quality Control Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> Contract<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands of professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p>As a contract employee of Sterling, you are eligible to receive a <strong>Full Em</strong><strong>ployee Benefits Package </strong>that includes <strong>paid time off, paid holidays, 3 medical plans to choose from, dental &amp; vision plans, 401(k), and an Employee Stock Ownership (ESOP) plan.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary: </strong><p><br></p>The Quality Control Analyst is responsible for analytical testing and data verification supporting both late-stage clinical and commercial biosimilar products in cGMP-compliant laboratories. This individual will also engage in continuous improvement initiatives to drive efficiency and effectiveness of Quality Systems. A strong background in protein chemistry will be essential to perform and troubleshoot techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. A demonstrated ability to collaborate across multiple departments to drive timely resolution of projects, laboratory investigations, and process improvements is required.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analytical testing to support product in-process, release, and stability programs.</li><li>Knowledge of cGMP, Quality Systems, and ICH / regulatory guidance.</li><li>Conduct, compile, and/or review Out of Specification lab investigations, deviations, and corrective and preventative actions plans.</li><li>Work with cross-functional teams to advance projects, maintain equipment, and author documents and reports.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in biotechnology, biochemistry, chemistry, or related field</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory. </li><li>Alternatively, Master’s degree in above areas with 1 year of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory or PhD in above areas.</li><li>Demonstrated success working with techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>#post</em></strong>

This individual will also engage in continuous improvement initiatives to drive efficiency and effectiveness of Quality Systems. A strong background in protein chemistry will be essential to perform and troubleshoot techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. A demonstrated ability to collaborate across multiple departments to drive timely resolution of projects, laboratory investigations, and process improvements is required.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analytical testing to support product in-process, release, and stability programs.</li><li>Knowledge of cGMP, Quality Systems, and ICH / regulatory guidance.</li><li>Conduct, compile, and/or review Out of Specification lab investigations, deviations, and corrective and preventative actions plans.</li><li>Work with cross-functional teams to advance projects, maintain equipment, and author documents and reports.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in biotechnology, biochemistry, chemistry, or related field</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory. </li><li>Alternatively, Master’s degree in above areas with 1 year of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory or PhD in above areas.</li><li>Demonstrated success working with techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>#post</em></strong>

title: Messaging Engineer II
description: <strong>Employer</strong>: Insurance Auto Auctions, Inc.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title</strong>: DEVELOPER (Multiple Positions Available)<p><br></p>Developer for Insurance Auto Auctions, Inc. in Westchester, IL. Design, develop, implement, and maintain solutions for all internet and intranet applications; Use Microsoft technology stack, including C#, ASP.NET, MVC, MVVM, Bootstrap, Kendo UI, Web API, WCF, RESTful and front-end technologies such as JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, HTML5, knockout JS, Microsoft Azure. Identify various layers of the applications, write down high level interfaces and methods in different tiers of application. Document the interfaces and methods using PlantUML tool. Write server-side web application code in C#/ASP.NET/MVC based on the design. Write web services, to be consumed by B2B partners, using WebAPI or WCF technologies depending on the application architecture. Describe the contents and appearance of the web pages using HTML5 as prototyped by UI/UX designers. Implement client-side code using Javascript, Jquery and KnockoutJS frameworks to provide the website users a dynamic UI and responsive UX. Conduct new product development and provide continuous enhancements to existing products as part of maintenance. Respond proactively to production support and testing of web applications. Write unit test to validate the work. Conduct integration testing by testing the application from UI layer till the data layer, ensuring the results of the test satisfy the required business need. Determine means, and supporting technologies, to help automate the unit/integration testing, of critical applications, as part of the build and deployment cycle to increase companywide DevOps adherence. Perform testing of web applications including Unit/Integration Testing. Create unit test for the web applications to maintain and increase the code coverage. Utilize mock framework to implement unit test. Perform integration testing across various enterprise applications. Create technical and test-case documents. Write documentation about the technical implementation of a feature and the unit test cases. Work with the quality assurance (QA) team to help them understand the technical implementation to help them increase the efficiency of their test planning. Provide end-user technology support and troubleshooting. Support end-users in using the product, including answering technical questions or clarifications in a timely fashion. Attend to any issues with the product in a timely fashion so that impact to the business continuity is minimized. Work on projects in converting existing COM+ components into .NET windows and web services while complying with the new Architecture guidelines using Messaging and Command and Eventing. Communicate product framework requirements to integrate with B2B partners. May work remotely anywhere in the United States.<p><br></p>Must possess Bachelor’s degree in Computer Applications, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Management Information Systems, or related field and five years of experience as a developer; or must possess a Master’s degree in Computer Applications, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Management Information Systems or related field and three years of experience as a developer. Must possess 3 years of experience with Microsoft technology stack, including the following: C#; ASP.NET; MVC; MVVM; Bootstrap; Kendo UI; Web API; WCF; RESTful; front-end technologies such as JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, HTML5, knockout JS; Microsoft Azure; HTML5; Plant UML; C#/ASP.NET/MVC based on the UML design; WebAPI or WCF technologies; and TypeScript. May work remotely anywhere in the United States.<p><br></p>Please submit résumé to Zeeshan Syed via email to zsyed@iaai.com, reference “DEVELOPER”. No agencies or phone calls please.

title: Telecom Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Location: </strong> Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Salary: </strong> $70,000.00 USD Annually - $110,000.00 USD Annually<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Recent graduates and Junior/Mid-level engineers are encouraged to apply!<p><br></p>System Verification Engineer will be designing and executing testing for new features and products for advanced WiFi and Network interfaces. Knowledge of User Experience is required with skills in Python scripting and Linux/Shell scripting.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong comprehension of the elements that contribute to an optimal User Experience (UX)</li><li>Background in IT application management; proficiency with UniFi considered an advantage</li><li>Excellent communication abilities, encompassing both verbal and written</li><li>Skilled in various networking technologies, such as WiFi, TCP/IP, switching, and routing</li><li>Practical experience with Linux and shell scripting</li><li>Knowledge of Python programming is favored</li><li>Capacity and eagerness to adapt quickly in a dynamic, fast-paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Conduct verification of User Experience (UX), features, and performance for UniFi applications, including but not limited to Network (inclusive of WiFi), Protect, Talk, Access, as well as upcoming platforms</li><li>Design and implement test setups, and strategize and execute manual as well as semi-automated test scenarios</li><li>Precisely report findings, employing clear visuals and providing comprehensive details</li><li>Foster collaboration with development teams to address and rectify identified issues</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Possess a bachelor's or master's degree in Information Technology, Network Management, Cyber Security, or a related discipline</li><li>Hold 1-2 years of relevant work experience, or be an imminent/recent graduate</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Contact:</strong> gvanschaick@judge.com<p><br></p><em>This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at www.judge.com</em>

title: Front-End Web Developer - Junior
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Community Development is responsible for managing the Bank’s Community Impact initiatives, providing financing to support community development in the communities we serve and cultivating relationships and partnerships with our local communities. CIBC Bank USA is committed to supporting causes that matter to our clients, our employees and our communities. We aim to make a difference in communities through specialized community development financing, corporate donations, sponsorships and the volunteer spirit of our employees.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p>The Quality Assurance Analyst’s primary role will be to support the Community Development Group to ensure compliance with regulatory and CIBC reporting requirements and monitoring of the existing Community Development Group loan portfolio.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsible for ensuring the Community Development Group’s compliance with Regulation B on a daily basis. Complete required Regulation B reporting to CIBC’s Compliance team on a monthly basis.</li><li>Completion of the risk rating validation of the Community Development Group loan portfolio on a quarterly basis (including fiscal year end).</li><li>Completion of monthly reporting on non-performing, criticized and past due loans to CIBC’s Credit Risk Management team.</li><li>Review transactions closed on a monthly basis to document and report any credit exceptions to Community Development Group’s credit policy and procedures. Assist with the reporting of credit exceptions to the Small Business Exception Forum.</li><li>Completion of Notices of Default and Collection letters to Community Development Group customers that are past due on loan payments (including loan maturities).</li><li>Provide necessary loan documents to CIBC’s outside collection agency for transactions that are transferred to collections.</li><li>Complete necessary reporting on Community Development Group real estate transactions.</li><li>Provide supporting documentation to support ongoing Compliance monitoring as well as annual Compliance audits.</li><li>Complete the necessary reporting to Compliance associated with any formal complaints received from existing or prospective Community Development Group customers.</li><li>Assist with updates of business-specific processes and procedures, as applicable, in alignment with existing frameworks, policies, standards, and risk appetites.</li><li>Assist with the account management including the monitoring of past due payments received from of distressed portfolio accounts. </li><li>Work with Governance &amp; Controls teams (1Bs) or Internal Audit as needed to respond to Internal Audit reviews and findings.</li><li>Support procedural training (as applicable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compliance Requirements/Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College education and equivalent of 3+ years of job experience in financial services industry.</li><li>Proficiency in banking applications and Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Possess creative problem-solving abilities</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li><li>Good organizational skills including attention to detail and follow through</li><li>Ability to work well under compressed time constraints</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at one time</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What you need to know:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-120 S LaSalle St<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Accounting, Business, Credit, Lending, Risk Management

title: quantitative developer
description: <strong><u>This Job Is For You If You<br></u></strong><ul><li>Are a front-end developer with required experience working with web standards, JavaScript, and angular js </li><li>Have an intellectual curiosity to pursue the unknown, to continuously improve, and ambition to grow in a fast-paced environment. </li><li>Have the ability to think like a customer (see not their own, but the user’s perspective) </li><li>Have the ability to communicate well with peers, cross-functional groups and international customers (excellent spoken and written English language skills)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to effectively communicate project solutions, process improvements, new trends, and technologies [and more] to organization, internal, cross-functional, and external, and keeps customers/stakeholders up to date on project development status. </li><li>Monitor the work done by her/his team members, mentor them able to deliver eCommerce (Magento and Bigcommerce) projects from a technical aspect. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience And Skills<br><br></u></strong><strong>Minimum<br></strong><ul><li>9-10 Years of experience as a developer and strong knowledge in various designing tools and techniques CSS and HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, angular JS, React Js Photo shop, Dream weaver, Flash, and Illustrator. </li><li>Hands-on experience working with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript libraries and their practical uses in building complex interactive experiences. </li><li>Experience in building websites in Magento 2. x Frontend Development </li><li>Deep knowledge of Customization of Magento Themes as per requirements. Knowledge in node JS, VueJS and ReactJS with Redux for Remix. NextJS (and or) NuxtJS </li><li>Should have worked on Headless Commerce and built commerce applications </li><li>Experience in GraphQl APIs and its implementation in Magento 2 PWA Studio &amp; Vue storefront / BigCommerce Storefront. </li><li>Good understanding of Frontend technologies and able to deliver eCommerce (Magento and Bigcommerce) projects from a technical aspect. </li><li>Follow best coding practices, theme setup, customizations, integrations with parties, connectors, and backend systems. </li><li>Should be strong in Written/communication skills <br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred<br></u></strong><ul><li>Magento JS Certification, General understanding of BigCommerce FE. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Candidate should have BE/BTech/MCA or BFA/MFA or have equivalent experience</li></ul>

title: Developer
description: This opportunity is working directly with a leading mission-critical data center developer / wholesaler / colo provider. This firm provides data center solutions custom-fit to the requirements of their client's mission-critical operational facilities. They provide reliability of mission-critical facilities for many of the world's largest organizations facilities supporting Enterprise Clients and Hyperscale Companies. This opportunity provides a career-growth minded role with exciting projects with leading-edge technology and innovation as well as competitive salaries and benefits.<p><br></p><strong>Data Center Facility Engineer - Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a Data Center Facility Engineer to support a critical data center. The Critical Facility Engineer will be responsible for monitoring compliance with contractual commitments, directing technical and administrative tasks related to the operation of the critical facility infrastructure and assuring compliance with company’s policies and procedures. The Data Center is a 7x24x365 a year operation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Troubleshoot and Run Diagnostics, Conduct Preventive Maintenance and Emergency Repairs on Critical Facilities Equipment within the Data Center as specified and on schedule</li><li>Participates in the preparation of analyses and reports on the data center infrastructure, develops project plans and conducts briefings and presentations</li><li>Partner when necessary with sub-contractors and vendors</li><li>Operate and perform both routine and emergency service on a variety of state of the art critical systems, including but not limited to; Critical power - low/medium voltage switchgear, diesel generators, paralleling switchboards, UPS, PDU, and building monitoring systems</li><li>Ensures that operational, maintenance and emergency methods of procedure (MOP’s and SOP’s) are developed and strictly adhered to</li><li>Assist with CMMS database management</li></ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of relevant / technical knowledge and practical experience of Critical Facilities Operations with Electrical and Mechanical / HVAC equipment such as: UPS, Generators, Switchgears, PDU's, CRAC Units, DC Power Systems, CRAH Units, Chillers, Air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, CRAH Units, DC Power Systems, and building monitoring/control systems</li><li>Must have experience in operating, troubleshooting and maintenance of Mission Critical Mechanical and/or Electrical Support Systems</li><li>Previous experience in the Military / Military veterans in all branches that have experience with Electrical / Mechanical is a huge plus (Navy Nukes- EMN, ETN, MMNs, Seabees, Army - Power Generation, Air Force – Power Production, Generator Techs, Maritime, Coast Guard, etc.)</li><li>Strong verbal, written communications skills</li><li>Experience working with various computer systems and applications</li></ul> <strong>Submittal Instructions:</strong><p><br></p>Please send your resume to resume@pkaza.com ( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 16232252 in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, https://www.pkaza.com/jobs/<p><br></p>If you are in Data Center Facilities but this opportunity is not what you are looking for let’s still talk. New openings are coming in weekly and others we are not allowed to post.<p><br></p>We also not only keep leads confidential but pay for referrals as well.<p><br></p>Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.<p><br></p><em>EOE/AA Employer M/F/D/V</em><p><br></p><em>Pkaza, LLC is a third party employment firm. All fees assessed by Pkaza will be paid by our employer that we represent and not by the candidate</em>

title: System Testing/Verification Engineer
description: <strong><u>Position Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Joseph T. Ryerson &amp; Son, Inc., a leading distributor and processor of metals with over 175 years of history, is seeking a Front-End Developer to join our Web Development team in Lisle, IL. Our ideal candidate will have JavaScript experience an understanding of tools, libraries, MVC frameworks, ReactJS and has also exposure to mobile application development framework like Cordova.<p><br></p><strong><u>Roles &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Planning and executing the implementation of ReactJS web and mobile apps, for internal and external users.</li><li> Collaborate and build a scalable, testable, and maintainable architecture.</li><li> Testing cross-browser, cross-platform and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies</li><li> Write HTML and CSS and work collaboratively with other engineers, product managers, executives, and designers to bring concepts to life.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum of 1-3 years developing for the web and/or mobile with a Bachelor’s in computer science Engineering, or similar technical degree</li><li> Candidate must be local, is not a remote position.</li><li> 1+ year of experience working with React.js</li><li> Excellent JavaScript / CSS / HTML</li><li> Expert in debugging JavaScript</li><li> Strong experience with React and Redux</li><li> Experience configuring and using front end build tools and packages managers such as npm, yarn, webpack, gulp</li><li> Experience with Test-driven development frameworks such as Jest.</li><li> Experience building single-page web application that performs and scale well in modern, mobile and legacy browsers.</li><li> Experience interfacing with REST APIs and/or API Gateways (GraphQL, ElasticSearch)</li><li> Thorough code documentation and technical specifications</li><li> Web application security should be one of your highest concerns. Knowledge in preventing and fixing exploits.</li><li> Experience with enterprise level software solutions, agile methodologies</li><li> Up to date knowledge of CSS3 and tools like SASS or LESS</li><li> Extreme attention to detail, strong desire to grow and keep up with the latest trends in front end technology, being humble and open to criticism, have a passion in delivering the best product possible are essential qualities for being successful in this role.</li></ul><p><br></p>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, and pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran, or any other federal, state or local protected class or artificial barrier.

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description: <strong>Job Title:</strong> Full Stack Developer<br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago, IL<br><strong>Job type and Duration: </strong>Permanent / Full-time<br> <br>Our client, a global Architecture and Design Firm, is hiring a Full Stack Developer to join their team in Chicago, IL.   <br> <br>The Full Stack Developer is a highly skilled computer programmer who is comfortable with both front and back-end programming. Responsibilities include participating in user interviews, developing and designing front end web user interfaces from a composable architecture, integrating existing data sets and models, developing and maintaining semantically driven object ontologies, and ensuring the responsiveness of applications, among other duties.<br>This position will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.<br><br><strong>Job Duties</strong><ul><li>Participation in user interviews to understand technical and customer needs.</li><li>Developing front-end website architecture based on Palantir Foundry.</li><li>Designing user interactions on web pages within Palantir Foundry Workshop.</li><li>Developing back-end website code logic that leverages semantic object linking (ontologies) within Palantir Foundry Code Workbook and Ontology Manager.</li><li>Creating servers, databases, and datasets for functionality as needed.</li><li>Ensuring the health of data connections and pipelines (utilizing filesystem, JDBC, SFTP, and webhook).</li><li>Ensuring conformance with security protocols and markings on sensitive data sets.</li><li>Ensuring responsiveness of web applications developed on low code/no code solutions.</li><li>Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.</li><li>Seeing through projects from conception to finished product.</li><li>Meeting both technical and customer needs.</li><li>Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.</li><li>Lead other engineers to develop features on your projects.</li></ul> <br><strong>Qualifications</strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field.</li><li>Minimum 5 years experience.</li><li>Strong organizational and project management skills.</li><li>Proficiency with low-code/no-code tools, Palantir Foundry experience preferred.</li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li><li>Familiarity with JavaScript libraries such as Lodash, Math.js, Moment, Numeral, and es6-shim.</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages for structured data processing; Python, PySpark, Java, Apache Spark, and SparkSQL in particular.</li><li>Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, and others.</li><li>Familiarity with analytical tools for business intelligence and data science such as Power BI, Jupyter, and R Studio.<br><br></li></ul><strong>ESPO Corporation<br></strong><strong><span><span><span><span>www.espocorp.com<br></span></span></span></span></strong><strong><span><span>View all open jobs at www.espocorp.com/jobs<br><br></span></span></strong><strong>Leaders in Technical Recruiting &amp; Staffing since 1965<br></strong><em>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workforce</em><em>.</em> All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other attribute or protected characteristic by law. If you need assistance applying please contact us directly.<br><br>
