Critical power - low/medium voltage switchgear, diesel generators, paralleling switchboards, UPS, PDU, and building monitoring systems</li><li>Ensures that operational, maintenance and emergency methods of procedure (MOP’s and SOP’s) are developed and strictly adhered to</li><li>Assist with CMMS database management</li></ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of relevant / technical knowledge and practical experience of Critical Facilities Operations with Electrical and Mechanical / HVAC equipment such as: UPS, Generators, Switchgears, PDU's, CRAC Units, DC Power Systems, CRAH Units, Chillers, Air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, CRAH Units, DC Power Systems, and building monitoring/control systems</li><li>Must have experience in operating, troubleshooting and maintenance of Mission Critical Mechanical and/or Electrical Support Systems</li><li>Previous experience in the Military / Military veterans in all branches that have experience with Electrical / Mechanical is a huge plus (Navy Nukes- EMN, ETN, MMNs, Seabees, Army - Power Generation, Air Force – Power Production, Generator Techs, Maritime, Coast Guard, etc.)</li><li>Strong verbal, written communications skills</li><li>Experience working with various computer systems and applications</li></ul> <strong>Submittal Instructions:</strong><p><br></p>Please send your resume to resume@pkaza.com ( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 16232152 in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, https://www.pkaza.com/jobs/<p><br></p>If you are in Data Center Facilities but this opportunity is not what you are looking for let’s still talk. New openings are coming in weekly and others we are not allowed to post.<p><br></p>We also not only keep leads confidential but pay for referrals as well.<p><br></p>Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.<p><br></p><em>EOE/AA Employer M/F/D/V</em><p><br></p><em>Pkaza, LLC is a third party employment firm. All fees assessed by Pkaza will be paid by our employer that we represent and not by the candidate</em>

title: Data Center Facility Engineer
description: <strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, Illinois (<strong>Local are preferred)<br><br></strong><strong>Skill Level:</strong> Senior Level (greater than 8 yrs exp.)<br><br>Hybrid Role must be located in Chicago<br><br><strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>DevOps Engineer will work with application developers to automate and accelerate the testing, release, and deployment of applications into a runtime environment. This role requires a background in development, operations, and full-stack software implementations.<br><ul><li> This is a hybrid role and must be located in Chicago (or within commutable distance) to be onsite as needed/ on occasion.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Is well versed in programming in a high-level language such as TypeScript, Python, Java, C# or other languages to script installation, configuration, and provisioning<br><br>Provide continuous delivery solutions in a cloud environment and have experience with the core suite of tools used to manage AWS cloud infrastructure<br><br>Establish and employ Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Harness, ArgoCD, Github Action or other CI tools<br><br>Configure management automation tools from AWS or other cloud providers in creating continuous delivery systems<br><br>Employ industry Continuous Delivery patterns and collaboratively work with other members to achieve successful continuous delivery solutions<br><br>Responsible for mentoring and teaching existing team members<br><br>Clearly explain solutions for complex problems and demonstrate ability to lead and impart knowledge effectively to junior resources<br><br>Continually improve cyber resilience.<br><br>Collect DevOps automation requirements from development teams<br><br>Design devops pipelines for applications based on existing company standards<br><br>Build cloud infrastructure pipelines based on existing company standards<br><br>Build CI/CD pipelines based on existing company standards for cloud applications<br><br>Support and maintain existing infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience<br><br>5 + years of experience spanning at least two IT disciplines, including technical architecture, application development, or operations<br><br>Experience optimizing applications, both stand-alone and in distributed systems to maximize performance<br><br>Experience maintaining infrastructure and ensuring stability while adding new features<br><br>Any AWS Certification<br><br>Familiarity with a broad portfolio of AWS infrastructure tools (EBS, S3, EC2, Elastic IP, Route 53, VPC) and experience with cloud infrastructure management and automation technologies<br><br>Comfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders<br><br>Comfort with frequent changes in priorities<br><br>Ability to clearly articulate design and implementation choices<br><br>Experience managing multi-tenant Kubernetes cluster<br><br>Continuous integration tools such as Harness ArgoCD, Github Action or similar<br><br>Scripting (Python, JS, GO Lang, Bash) skills for monitoring and automation<br><br>Possess a strong grasp of automation tools<br><br>Critical thinking and problem-solving skills<br><br>Time and priority management<br><br>A team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills<br><br><strong><u>Preferred<br><br></u></strong>Experience leading small Teams<br><br>AWS CDK<br><br>Object-Oriented Programming Experience<br><br><strong>AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: </strong>FLC Infotech, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related), gender identity or expression, genetic information including sickle cell or hemoglobin C trait, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local law.<br><br>You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident, or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future.<br><br>FLC Infotech, Inc. requires proof of COVID-19 vaccination for all employees. Reasonable accommodations will be considered. If an employee is unable to provide proof of vaccination, mask coverings, and weekly COVID-19 testing will be implemented.

title: Front End Developer - IL Lisle
description: Project Manager/Business Analyst '2013 Chicago<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for an experienced Project Manager/Business Analyst (PM/BA) as we continue to grow our Chicago-based practice. We are looking for people with aptitude, intelligence, and desire as this role is the primary point of contact with the client. This role will require effective communication and the ability to focus on high quality work under pressure in leading technical and non-technical audiences. The successful candidate will work directly with clients and internal staff to estimate, plan and manage projects to successful completion.<p><br></p>Our solution offerings include custom design, integrated solutions that leverage third-party software and COTS products, and highly configurable, low code case management solutions that that incorporate leading-edge technologies. These include cloud-based mobility, data analytics and visualizations, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.<p><br></p>As a Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work in a collaborative environment within our project teams where you will track, manage and report upon scope, schedule, budget for client projects. This PM/BA role, frequent and clear communication is necessary to establish productive and balanced relationships with customer stakeholders and sponsors.<p><br></p>You will participate in project planning and assessment engagements where you will work closely with our customers to present and document options, recommendations, and roadmaps to support their long-term planning and strategy.<p><br></p>You will also work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in obtaining requirements from clients, lead and take part in JAD sessions and work with internal and external stakeholders.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities Include</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Create, update, and manage project schedule using Microsoft Project or other client-approved software.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Control and manage project scope, budget, activities, and expectations to ensure profitability of RedMane projects.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Regularly track, report, and analyze project status, including scheduling and conducting regular status meetings, and creating client-facing status reports.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Create and manage Risk, Change and Issues registers for the project.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Plan, schedule and manage project activities with clients.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Regularly manage, interact, and collaborate with RedMane project team members.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Plan and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Ability to lead design sessions and workshops with clients to capture functional requirements.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Facilitate discussions and resolution of project-related issues and blockers if they arise.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Create monthly reports and forecasts to RedMane executive management of project status, schedule, milestones, and budget.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Facilitate, schedule, and plan Executive Steering Committee meetings for projects '2013 including creation of presentations and other material to effectively communicate project progress.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>The PM/BA candidate will need to have:<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>7 years of project management and/or business analysis experience with increasing scope of responsibility.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience in crafting project proposals, developing work estimates and project schedules.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience in project planning and control of multi-year and multi-phase projects.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience with the identification and mitigation of project risk.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Proficiency with project management tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint).<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Strong interpersonal and management skills with an excellent attention to detail.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience managing projects involving data analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT is a plus, but not required.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>PMP certification is a plus, but not required.<p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<p><br></p>'2003<p><br></p>Travel Requirements<p><br></p>The position may involve periodic travel to client locations within the US.<p><br></p>We Offer You<p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include</u></strong><p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.<p><br></p><ul><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.

title: Full Stack Developer
description: For more than 30 years, ECI Software Solutions has been providing industry-specific, cloud-based business management software and services to small and medium-sized businesses. With divisions focused on manufacturing, wholesale/retail distribution, building and construction, and field service, ECI's solutions integrate into every aspect of a customers' business to help them level the playing field, run day-to-day operations more efficiently, and free them up to focus on what matters most. It’s how business gets done.<p><br></p><strong> Who is ECI? </strong><p><br></p>At ECI, our mission is to enable the entrepreneurial spirit of small and medium-sized business owners. But ECI doesn’t simply deliver amazing software solutions; we also have an award-winning company culture.<p><br></p><ul><li> We offer competitive benefits focused on employee well-being, including paid volunteer time off! </li><li> We have been named by Achievers on its prestigious 50 Most Engaged Companies To Work For list for the last five years. </li><li> We have received international recognition for our high levels of employee engagement through Certification as a Great Place to Work four years in a row. </li><li> Our culture of creativity, innovation, and leadership has garnered over a dozen International Business Awards (Stevie®). </li></ul><p><br></p>Come join a worldwide team with a strong culture of inclusion, professional development, and collaboration.<p><br></p>To apply for this position, please attach a detailed resume that demonstrates your qualifications and skill set pertaining to this position. Applications without a resume will not be considered.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities</strong> include, but are not limited to the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Research and analyze assigned projects to determine what is required to complete the customer’s request successfully. </li><li> Provide detailed estimates for projects based on client-provided technical and functional requirements. </li><li> Ensure estimates of time and cost are as accurate as possible and projects are completed to our quality standards, on time, and within budget. </li><li> Design and code custom web applications and/or report changes. </li><li> Thoroughly test and review each completed project for 100% accuracy. </li><li> Record tasks, time, and communication directly related to each custom project. </li><li> Provide exceptional level of customer service for the customer and communicate with the customer directly as needed throughout the process of any project. </li><li> Learn new software and technologies as needed to maintain technical skills. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong technical skills with C#, Javascript, and HTML </li><li> Microsoft SQL Server &amp; MySQL (MariaDB) Knowledge (for database &amp; queries) </li><li> .NET MVC Framework Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Git Source Code Control Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Stimulsoft Reports Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills </li><li> Outstanding time management skills including the ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Detailed and well-organized written communications skills </li><li> Effective interpersonal skills including communication, teaching, active listening, and customer service </li><li> Able to work as a team player and/or individual contributor internally and externally </li><li> Must be based in the United States </li></ul><p><br></p>You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.<p><br></p>In addition to our competitive salary and award winning culture, we offer an excellent benefit package. We even offer our employees a day off to serve their community! Our company core values are our “CODE”: Crave Greatness, Own the Outcome, Deliver Awesome and Embrace Community.<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p>

MySQL (MariaDB) Knowledge (for database &amp; queries) </li><li> .NET MVC Framework Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Git Source Code Control Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Stimulsoft Reports Knowledge (not required, but a plus) </li><li> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills </li><li> Outstanding time management skills including the ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Detailed and well-organized written communications skills </li><li> Effective interpersonal skills including communication, teaching, active listening, and customer service </li><li> Able to work as a team player and/or individual contributor internally and externally </li><li> Must be based in the United States </li></ul><p><br></p>You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.<p><br></p>In addition to our competitive salary and award winning culture, we offer an excellent benefit package. We even offer our employees a day off to serve their community! Our company core values are our “CODE”: Crave Greatness, Own the Outcome, Deliver Awesome and Embrace Community.<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p>

title: Project Manager- FBusiness Analyst
description: Role: DevOps Engineer IV -Hybrid - Day 1 Onsite<p><br></p>Location: Chicago, IL<p><br></p>Client: United Airlines<p><br></p>Duration: 12+ Months contract to hire<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Is well versed in programming in a high-level language such as TypeScript, Python, Java, C# or other languages to script installation, configuration, and provisioning</li><li> Provide continuous delivery solutions in a cloud environment and have experience with the core suite of tools used to manage AWS cloud infrastructure</li><li> Establish and employ Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Harness, ArgoCD, Github Action or other CI tools</li><li> Configure management automation tools from AWS or other cloud providers in creating continuous delivery systems</li><li> Employ industry Continuous Delivery patterns and collaboratively work with other members to achieve successful continuous delivery solutions</li><li> Responsible for mentoring and teaching existing team members</li><li> Clearly explain solutions for complex problems and demonstrate ability to lead and impart knowledge effectively to junior resources</li><li> Continually improve cyber resilience.</li><li> Collect DevOps automation requirements from development teams</li><li> Design devops pipelines for applications based on existing company standards</li><li> Build cloud infrastructure pipelines based on existing company standards</li><li> Build CI/CD pipelines based on existing company standards for cloud applications</li><li> Support and maintain existing infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience</li><li> 5 + years of experience spanning at least two IT disciplines, including technical architecture, application development, or operations</li><li> Experience optimizing applications, both stand-alone and in distributed systems to maximize performance</li><li> Experience maintaining infrastructure and ensuring stability while adding new features</li><li> Any AWS Certification</li><li> Familiarity with a broad portfolio of AWS infrastructure tools (EBS, S3, EC2, Elastic IP, Route 53, VPC) and experience with cloud infrastructure management and automation technologies</li><li> Comfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders</li><li> Comfort with frequent changes in priorities</li><li> Ability to clearly articulate design and implementation choices</li><li> Experience managing multi-tenant Kubernetes cluster</li><li> Continuous integration tools such as Harness ArgoCD, Github Action or similar</li><li> Scripting (Python, JS, GO Lang, Bash) skills for monitoring and automation</li><li> Possess a strong grasp of automation tools</li><li> Critical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li> Time and priority management</li><li> A team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience leading small Teams</li><li> AWS CDK</li><li> Object-Oriented Programming Experience</li></ul>

title: Custom Software Developer
description: ESFM<p><br></p><strong>Salary: </strong><p><br></p><strong>Other Forms of Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>ESFM is the corporate Integrated Facilities Management (IFM) division of Compass Group USA and a Keystone member of the International WELL Building Institute (IWBI).<p><br></p>Rooted in hospitality, ESFM elevates the workplace experience as the single source of innovative FM solutions that ensure a safe, healthy, and sustainable environment. ESFM’s clients include many household names from Life Science, Technology, Oil &amp; Gas and Manufacturing markets.<p><br></p>ESFM self-performs 80% of all IFM solutions provided to clients. Their portfolio of service categories includes Environment, Health &amp; Safety, Facilities Maintenance &amp; Engineering, Sustainability, Janitorial &amp; Industrial Cleaning, Laboratory Support and Workplace solutions. This self-performance model creates a consistent hospitality experience for clients, resulting in higher engagement and productivity from their employees.<p><br></p>In 2020, ESFM (formerly Eurest Services) won the George Graves Award for Facility Management Achievement from the International Facilities Management Association (IFMA).<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Job Summary</strong></u><p><br></p>The <strong>ServiceNow Developer</strong> is an important resource for the ongoing custom development of applications/modules running on the ServiceNow platform. The <strong>ServiceNow Developer </strong>will work with several teams to maintain existing code as well as to develop new features/functionality on both the desktop and mobile applications to support the business needs.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Under general direction, independently develops, maintains and extends a stable production, development and testing middleware infrastructure while extending the functionality and enabling developers to use it via mentoring and formal training</li><li> Independently develops, modifies, and implements moderately to highly complex information systems that are thorough and accurate and conform to MST standards</li><li> Codes, tests, debugs, and documents assignments of moderate to high complexity. This includes both desktop and mobile applications</li><li> Independently researches and resolves more complex technical problems in both production and non-production environments</li><li> A top level technical contributor in highly specialized phases of applications system architecture with strong technical (applications based) knowledge</li><li> May serve as project manager or team lead on complex projects</li><li> Based on customer requirements, formulates/defines systems scope and objectives</li><li> Researches, develops, codes or modifies architecture components that are well designed, efficient and conform to MST architectural standards</li><li> When assuming the project manager role, manages day-to-day project-related activities for projects of moderate to high complexity</li><li> Work with multiple business owners to move forward development and enhancements around Nuvolo’s Facility Management modules including Work Orders and Asset management and Core ServiceNow Modules including Surveys, Service Portal and Record Producers in a Multi-Tenant Instance separated by custom query business rules</li><li> Build and maintain internal and external facing mobile device friendly ServiceNow modules using client-side browser technologies (e.g., JavaScript, jQuery, JSON)</li><li> Integrate front-end UI with backend service APIs using JSON, REST or XML</li><li> Work with clients to identify target use cases for automation, as well as defining and documenting business and functional requirements for software development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline, or comparable industry experience</li><li> ServiceNow Certified System Administrator</li><li> ServiceNow Certified Application Developer</li><li> ServiceNow Mobile Experience Required</li><li> Ability to build ServiceNow Reports, dashboards and homepages</li><li> Ability to set up data security via control rules, domain separation</li><li> 3 to 5 years in ServiceNow configuration and development experience</li><li> Good hands-on knowledge and experience with any one or more areas: JavaScript / HTML/ CSS / AJAX / Angular / Bootstrap / Jelly Script</li><li> Experience administering a ServiceNow instance including group roles, permissions, modifications for business rules, workflows, UI pages, UI actions, UI policies.</li><li> Minimum 10 years of total IT/cybersecurity experience</li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience supporting the implementation, administration, configuration and/or development of the ServiceNow tool</li><li> Excellent interpersonal skills and effective communication skills are necessary to be able to translate technical information to non-technical audiences</li><li> Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting deadlines</li><li> Experience in facilities management industry a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Apply to ESFM Services today!</strong><p><br></p>ESFM is a member of Compass Group USA<p><br></p><strong>Click Here To Learn More About The Compass Story</strong><p><br></p><strong>Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with a criminal history (including relevant driving history), in a manner consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York Fair Chance Act. We encourage applicants with a criminal history (and driving history) to apply.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Eurest services maintains a drug-free workplace.</strong><p><br></p>Req ID: 1203901<p><br></p>ESFM<p><br></p>Lacey Woodard

title: Full Stack Developer
description: <strong>Objectives</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Operate production environments by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health</li><li>Build software and systems to manage platform infrastructure and applications (IaC)</li><li>Improve reliability, quality, cost, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions</li><li>Measure and optimize system performance</li><li>Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple large-scale distributed software applications</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with a team of Site Reliability Engineers to implement DevOps culture, infrastructure reliability, and collaborate to solve day-to-day problems</li><li>Work with development teams and outside contractors to enhance and support existing business applications that focus on health analytics</li><li>Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning</li><li>Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service-level objectives</li><li>Gather and analyze metrics from operating systems as well as applications to assist in performance tuning and reliability troubleshooting</li><li>Help optimize costs and ensure compliance with enterprise security and audit requirements</li><li>Spend time on an alternating on-call schedule to troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure problems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Amazon Web Services such as EC2, VPC, S3, IAM, EKS, Lambda, RDS</li><li>Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform</li><li>Docker and containerization for development and continuous integration</li><li>Kubernetes cluster administration and related continuous delivery systems using Helm Charts</li><li>Support of applications written in node.js, Ruby on Rails, and React</li><li>Logging and monitoring tools such as Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK</li><li>Management of load balancers using HaProxy and ELB</li><li>Linux system administration and networking</li><li>Bash scripting and knowledge of high-level programming languages such as Javascript or Python</li><li>Continuous integration tools such as Github Actions, CircleCI, or Gitlab CI</li><li>Continuous deployment tools such as Jenkins, ArgoCD, or Gitlab</li><li>Administration and performance tuning of postgres databases</li><li>Configuration management using Ansible and Packer</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills And Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Performance tuning systems with high volume traffic, large data sets, and complex data analytics queries</li><li>Big Data solutions such as Spark, EMR, and Redshift</li><li>Management of multi-account AWS organizations with AWS Control Tower</li><li>Tableau administration</li></ul><p><br></p>As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.<p><br></p>Zelis provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.<p><br></p>SCAM ALERT: There is an active nationwide employment scam which is now using Zelis to garner personal information or financial scams. We will never asked for the exchange of any money or credit card details during the recruitment process. Please be aware of any suspicious email activity from people who could be pretending to be recruiters or senior professionals at Zelis.

title: Field Test Engineer
description: **Software Engineer**<p><br></p>Location **IL, Mt. Prospect**<p><br></p>Department **Engineering**<p><br></p>Employment Type **Full Time**<p><br></p>**Software Engineer**<p><br></p>**Crane Payment Innovations**<p><br></p>**Mount Prospect, IL**<p><br></p>Crane Payment Innovations is the leader in world class automated payment solutions.<p><br></p>We partner with businesses to provide payment experiences that set new and innovative standards for consumer convenience, security and reliability.<p><br></p>We are excited to explore new ways every day to improve how millions of people across the globe can make their payments in a way that fits with their lives.<p><br></p>Our global engineers develop products and deliver innovative solutions in currency validation technologies, cash management systems, digital payment technologies, mobile applications, security and digital advertising.<p><br></p>We offer a range of devices for bill and coin validation, cash recycling and dispensing systems, IoT applications for our enterprise-level connected products and services, and software applications to integrate sensory hardware to machines and networks.<p><br></p>At CPI you will become a valuable part of an inclusive culture of collaboration and innovation with the support of over 2,000 associates working in one of our 15 offices across the world.<p><br></p>If you want to have a hands-on global impact on payment solutions, we want you to join our team as a Software Engineer.<p><br></p>This is a full-time position based at our Mt. Prospect Office in the Chicagoland area.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Function</u></strong><p><br></p>The **Software Engineer** will design and develop software to support our existing coin or note counters.<p><br></p>This individual will assist with all phases of the software development cycle.<p><br></p>**Responsibilities and Duties**<p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skill Sets</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experienced in designing and testing new code in C/C+</li><li>for or Linux or Windows environment</li><li>Writing web-based applications using ASP, HTML5, JavaScript</li><li>Using installation tools to create and maintain Linux or Windows based installation packages</li><li>Provide support and development for automation test scripts</li><li>Utilizing version control system to manage product revisions: Git and ClearCase</li><li>Creating and maintaining issues using JIRA</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug for root cause of system/subsystem failures</li><li>Experienced in adhering to an established engineering development process, – CPI EDP – (proof-of-concept, prototyping, design, integration/test, associated documentation)</li><li>Core</li></ul><p><br></p>Skillsets:**<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work in a cross functional team environment</li><li>Good communications skillsets (verbal, written, presenting, etc.)</li><li>Computer skillsets (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Electrical Design ( IDEs ), etc</li><li>Self-Motivated – takes initiative to address issues, pursue new designs, identify cost reductions, researching of new parts</li><li>Innovative – Ability to design from a broad mandate statement, thinking out of the box, etc</li><li>Accountable – Assumes full responsibility of their designs or other designs which they have been assigned to maintain or debug</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Value Added Skillsets</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with Kaizen methodology and Continuous Improvement Tools</li></ul><p><br></p>**Qualifications and Required Skills**<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Experience with creating architecture for Embedded Machines</li><li>4-7 years of experience in software development</li><li>Strong software/hardware debugging skillsets</li><li>Familiarity with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, digital analysers, IDEs, debug modules, DVM, data communication analysis tools, etc</li></ul><p><br></p>**Key Attributes for Success**<p><br></p><ul><li>High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities</li><li>Excellent influencing skills, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to establish credibility and be decisive and able to recognize and support the organization's preferences and priorities</li><li>Results and people oriented with sound judgment—ability to balance other business considerations</li><li>Team player – able to work in a matrix organization</li><li>Excellent communication skills verbally and in writing</li><li>Up to 10% travel</li></ul><p><br></p>**We offer**<p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salaries</li><li>Paid time off</li><li>Sick time off</li><li>Medical, dental, &amp; vision insurance</li><li>Flexible spending accounts</li><li>Life insurance and disability benefits</li><li>401K with Company contribution</li><li>Community involvement</li><li>Opportunities to travel and work at our global sites</li></ul><p><br></p>**Be a part of Crane Payment Innovations and Crane Co.**<p><br></p>CPI is a part of Crane Co., a diversified manufacturer of highly engineered industrial products. Founded in 1855, Crane Co provides products and solutions to customers in four business segments: Aerospace &amp; Electronics, Fluid Handling, Engineered Materials, and Payment &amp; Merchandising Systems.<p><br></p>Crane has approximately 12,000 employees in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Crane Co. is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE:CR).<p><br></p>Crane Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.<p><br></p>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <strong><u>Position Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Ryerson has an opportunity for a QA engineer. As a QA Engineer you are responsible for overseeing all aspects of software and product testing within the group. This may involve developing test strategies, creating test documents, identifying errors, and reviewing QA reports.<p><br></p>The future will be made from metal. At Ryerson, you have the opportunity to grow in your career, work with teammates that feel like family, and help make our world a better place<p><br></p><strong><u>Roles And Responsilbities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Create automation tests to identify software problems within Mendix platform</li><li> Analyze bugs and errors found during tests</li><li> Check consistency across devices, browsers, and operating systems</li><li> Identify and prioritize test conditions addressing product risks and features to be tested</li><li> Participate in the technical review process contributing behavioral viewpoint</li><li> Maintain Automation test documentation</li><li> Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Five year’s experience in automation testing with a Bachelor’s Degree, or 10 years experience in automation testing with a High School Diploma</li><li>Strong knowledge of Linux and Microsoft Windows</li></ul><p><br></p>ISolid skills in Javascript, Typescript, SQL, and XML<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience using WebdriverIO, Selenium Webdriver, Azure DevOps, JIRA, GitHub</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Good oral and written communication skills</li><li>Great team player and able to work efficiently with minimal supervision</li></ul><p><br></p>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, and pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran, or any other federal, state or local protected class or artificial barrier.

title: Software Engineer
description: Contract | $50-60/hr | Chicago,VA<p><br></p>Job Description A Chicago consultancy is seeking a Fullstack Java Developer to join their team. They work with many well-known Chicago-based companies to support clients on a full technology life cycle from architecture and design to deployments and scalability.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate is a team player with strong communication and experience in customer-facing roles. This is a fullstack development position. They are leveraging Java, Angular, Spring Boot, Microservices, and databases like Oracle and MongoDB. title: Java Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: We are actively partnering with a global diversified technology manufacturing company that is seeking a fully remote Sustainability Project Manager. The objective of this role is to enhance the companys Sustainability Footprint/Reporting with respect to the companys internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have strong project management experience within a large, global company. The Role: Provides project management support for annual sustainability disclosures Conducts research and benchmark review to help advise the companys sustainability reporting strategy Monitors key milestones and deliverables from global sustainability steering committee Manages engagement with ESG rating agencies to verify company information Supports IT general controls for ESG data collection software Supports data collection of environmental data into central software platform, conducts analysis of site progress, and supports site sustainability teams Manages a Sustainability Analyst You: 5 year of experience in sustainability, project management, quality assurance or supply chain ideally within a large global company Bachelors degree required Excellent communication skills and high proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite 2 years of management experience Ability to travel Beacon Hill is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply. If you would like to complete our voluntary self-identification form, please click here or copy and paste the following link into an open window in your browser: https://jobs.beaconhillstaffing.com/eeoc/ Completion of this form is voluntary and will not affect your opportunity for employment, or the terms or conditions of your employment. This form will be used for reporting purposes only and will be kept separate from all other records. Company Profile: Founded by industry leaders to set a new standard in search, career placement and flexible staffing, we deliver coordinated staffing solutions with unparalleled service, a commitment to project completion and success and a passion for innovation, creativity and continuous improvement. Our niche brands offer a complete suite of staffing services to emerging growth companies and the Fortune 500 across market sectors, career specialties/disciplines and industries. Over time, office locations, specialty practice areas and service offerings will be added to address ever changing constituent needs. Learn more about Beacon Hill Staffing Group and our specialty divisions, Beacon Hill Associates, Beacon Hill Financial, Beacon Hill HR, Beacon Hill Legal, Beacon Hill Life Sciences and Beacon Hill Technologies by visiting www.beaconhillstaffing.com . We look forward to working with you. Beacon Hill. Employing the Future (TM)

title: Android Developer
description: Contract | $50-70/hr | Chicago,Illinois<p><br></p>Our client, a non-profit organization based in the NorthWest Suburbs, is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join their team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing applications using C# and .NET, with a focus on creating robust code. The releases of these applications will be carried out using Azure cloud infrastructure building pipelines.<p><br></p>We are looking for a seasoned developer who possesses strong skills in SQL server. This expertise will greatly contribute to the success of the individual in this position.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills &amp; Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6</li><li>years of experience with C# and .NET technology(.NET 6, MVC 5)</li><li>Full-stack development experience with JavaScript(Angular 12+)</li><li>Expert at working with SQL server</li><li>Skilled at working with ORM like Entity, LINQ</li><li>CI/CD experience, building pipelines</li><li>Ability to work in Scrum environment</li><li>Great communication skills both written and verbal.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills &amp; Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>.NET core, .NET 6 experience</li><li>Experience with Azure tools Azure DevOps, Azure Service Bus CosmoDB, Azure Data Factory</li><li>JavaScript experience using Angular</li></ul><p><br></p>What You Will Be Doing<p><br></p><ul><li>30% Frontend work</li><li>70% Backend work</li></ul><p><br></p>The Offer<p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive the following benefits:</li><li>Medical Insurance</li><li>Dental Benefits</li><li>Vision Benefits</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401K with 10% match</li><li>Wellness Benefit</li></ul><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>*Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future*<p><br></p>Motion Recruitment Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including EOE Protected Veterans/Disability/Women. All applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full-time basis in the country for which they are applying, and no sponsorship is currently available. Employment is subject to the successful completion of a pre-employment background screening including a criminal check. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under Motion Recruitment Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Sporting Industry
description: Experienced Java Developer / Analyst '2013 Chicago<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Description</u></strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p>The Role<p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a Java Developer/Analyst as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a Developer/Analyst you will provide system analysis, development and production support as part of a project team. The Developer/Analyst will design functional and technical approaches to create and customize functionality. The Developer/Analyst is also responsible for the execution of testing, training, support of user testing and customer support post implementation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Minimum 5 years- 7 of Java 8 based Web Application development experience with a strong understanding of Core Java fundamentals.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Minimum 3 years WebSphere or any application server JBoss, Tomcat, etc.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Expertise in working with JSP and servlets.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Strong OOD OOP skills.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Experience using modern front-end frameworks (JavaScript) like Angular, React, Vue, etc. to improve front end functionality.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience In Remediating Vulnerabilities Identified In Penetration Testing.</u></strong><p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Ability to articulate and document a detailed technical design.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Analyze and revises existing system logic and provides concise documentation.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Provide support and enhancements to legacy production systems.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Perform review of code from team members and ability to mentor team members<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Hands-on experience with SQL server, DB2 knowledge a plus<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Work both independently and as a strong team player to deliver quality technology solutions.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Minimum education required is a Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or directly related field.<p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these qualities:<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Demonstrate a clear pride of ownership.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Propose new ideas, relentless focus on quality and continuous improvement.<p><br></p>We Offer You<p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p><strong><u>RedMane Is Very Proud To Offer Employees Professional And Personal Perks That Include</u></strong><p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k- 7s to triathlons.<p><br></p>+<p><br></p>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.

title: Sustainability Project Manager
description: <strong>What’s so interesting about this role?</strong><p><br></p>The role of the SDET Engineer encompasses various responsibilities, including designing innovative automated test strategies and frameworks. They are also responsible for executing and automating tests to meet software testing requirements. Collaboration with engineering team members is essential for the SDET Engineer, as they work together to develop, update, and improve the test automation framework and infrastructure.<p><br></p>Furthermore, the SDET Engineer will carry out scheduled tests, provide reports on the test results, and effectively manage any identified defects. They will also perform regression testing for software fixes related to both new and existing features. Additionally, the SDET Engineer will assist the development team in reproducing and troubleshooting issues, while also developing new test automation solutions whenever required.<p><br></p><strong>What’s the job? </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Champion the quality of the product and strive for team goals</li><li>Maintain client-automated testing tools and increase automated test coverage</li><li>Collaborate with coworkers to enhance existing client automation frameworks, compare alternative testing approaches, and build new systems</li><li>Manage Grindr’s cloud testing tools and collaborate with their support teams</li><li>Increase efficiency by listening to development feedback and ensuring test framework, execution, and reporting is streamlined and useful</li><li>Monitor, investigate, and identify problems during the development process, pair with client development to diagnose and test fixes</li><li>Contribute to the team’s agile effort by estimating, measuring and improving through active participation and providing feedback on quality issues</li><li>Coordinate and participate in discussions about holistic testing approaches with the development teams, so we have a balance of manual testing, UI automation testing, and unit testing coverage</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We’ll Love About You</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 3 years of experience in a mobile SDET role</li><li>Experience with mobile automation frameworks; including Espresso (Android), XCUITest (iOS), or Appium</li><li>Strong programming skills in an object-oriented language (i.e. Kotlin, Swift, Java)</li><li>Significant experience automating repeated tasks and building test coverage with existing tools</li><li>Knowledge of test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases and debugging</li><li>Thorough understanding of the SDLC and tooling (GIT, branching/merging, build systems, CI tools and methodologies)</li><li>Experience with API testing or integration (REST APIs)</li><li>Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, be self-motivated, and be goal oriented is essential to excel in this role</li><li>Strong English verbal and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We’ll really swoon if you have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong programming skills with Swift or Kotlin</li><li>Considerable experience with Espresso or XCUITest automation</li><li>Track record of delivering complex automation and new frameworks</li><li>Extensive experience with various types of testing including unit, system, integration, user acceptance, regression, usability and end-to-end testing</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Love About Us</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Mission and Impact: Grindr is the world-leading LGBTQ social networking service. Your role will impact the lives of millions of LGBTQ people around the world</li><li>Multiple Locations: We currently have offices in LA, NYC, and Chicago, and are hiring someone for this role to be based ideally in Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York City, or Chicago</li><li>Family Insurance: Insurance premium coverage for health, dental, and vision for you and partial coverage for your dependents</li><li>Retirement Savings: Generous 401K plan with 6% match and immediate vest in the US</li><li>Queer-Inclusive Benefits: Industry-leading gender-affirming offerings with up to 90% cost coverage, access to Included Health, monthly stipends for HRT, and more</li><li>Additional Benefits: Flexible vacation policy, monthly stipends for cell phone, internet, wellness, and food, one-time home-office setup stipend, and company-sponsored events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Grindr</strong><p><br></p>Grindr is the world’s largest dating app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. With around 13 million monthly active users, Grindr has become a fundamental part of the global LGBTQ community, and we take pride in empowering our users to connect, express themselves, and discover the queer world around them.<p><br></p>Our next evolution is underway as a newly public company looking to expand and continue to build meaningful experiences for our users. From social issues to original content, we’re blazing innovative paths with impact for our community, all while leveraging the latest tech stacks and striving for engineering excellence. At the heart of our work in this new chapter is a shared set of core values: openness and exploration, a bias for action, and strong support of the LGBTQ community.<p><br></p>With a track record of strong financial performance and plans for continued headcount growth, we’re looking to build a team of talented, passionate, and open-minded people who believe in our mission, align with our values, and are excited to work at the intersection of innovative technology and social impact. Come be a part of this exciting journey with us.<p><br></p><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer</em></strong><p><br></p><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><strong>About Grindr</strong><p><br></p>Since launching in 2009, Grindr has grown into the world’s largest social networking app for gay, bi, trans, and queer people. We have millions of daily users who use our location-based technology in almost every country in every corner of the planet.<p><br></p>Today, Grindr proudly represents a modern LGBTQ+ lifestyle that expands into new platforms. From social issues to original content, we continue to blaze innovative paths with a meaningful impact for our community. At Grindr, we create a safe space where you can discover, navigate, and get zero feet away from the queer world around you.<p><br></p>As of June 2020, Grindr has new owners with a track record of multiple successful Bay Area start-ups. The new leadership is demonstrating a renewed commitment to creating an experience for users that is safe, fun, and productive, as well as a positive &amp; uplifting company culture in which everyone can be their best selves. At the heart of Grindr’s mission in this new chapter is a shared set of core values including transparency, accountability, experimentation (failing fast), and strong allegiance to the LGBTQ+ community.<p><br></p><strong><em>Grindr is an equal-opportunity employer</em></strong><p><br></p><em>To learn more about how we handle the personal data of applicants, visit our</em> <em>Employee and Candidate Privacy Policy</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>Grindr is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, location, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role will also be eligible for equity and benefits.</em><p><br></p>Base Pay Range<p><br></p>$100,000—$160,000 USD

title: Full Stack .NET Developer
description: <strong>Title: C# .Net developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Oakbrook IL<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands for professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> Direct Hire<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Looking for strong C# .Net skills. This role is responsible for developing and maintaining development platforms. This includes, but is not limited to middleware that serves as the foundation platforms.<p><br></p><strong>This is hybrid position with expectation to be on site 3 days a week (Monday, Wednesday and 3rd day of choice)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Work using Agile methodologies such as Scrum to develop middleware</li><li> Analyze requirements, collaborate with architects and senior engineers to produce thoughtful software designs of moderate scope and complexity</li><li> Participate in peer reviews and pull requests to yield high quality software</li><li> Present software concepts, designs, or code in a design review forum</li><li> Provide mentoring and coaching to junior engineers to increase the software development capability of the middleware team. Be a reliable source for technical troubleshooting and support for the scrum team</li><li> Lead and contribute to technical discussions in community of practice, design review, or other technical meeting forums</li><li> Work with offshore teams to design and develop features, and burn down technical debt</li><li> Ensure adherence to coding standards and other best practices to create reusable code</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 4 years of job-related experience</li><li> Experience with Agile methodologies and Scrum is required</li><li> Experience in creating technical documentation is required</li><li> Experience with Microsoft technology stack, including .NET, C#, SQL, Azure</li><li> Thorough understanding of OOP, SOLID, and RESTful services</li><li> Basic understanding of dependency injection and cloud development</li><li> Understanding of MQTT &amp; AMQP, experience with RabbiMQ</li><li> Understanding of CI/CD (continuous integration/continuous delivery) tools, frameworks and deployment processes</li><li> Experience supporting project plan creation, and reporting progress to functional management at a project level</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong>
